Adjacent to the amusement park, it offers thrilling rides and water sports, perfect for families and adventure seekers. Clean and well-kept, the beach also boasts delicious local eateries. A vibrant yet tranquil escape, Golden Beach is a Chennai treasure worth exploring.

Marina Beach offers a captivating experience with its vast expanse of golden sand and the rhythmic sounds of the waves. Visitors often appreciate the vibrant atmosphere, with families, joggers, and tourists enjoying the scenic beauty. The beach is a popular spot for leisurely strolls and enjoying local street food. Sunset at Marina Beach is particularly cherished, providing a breathtaking view. While some reviews mention the crowd, many find the overall experience to be refreshing and culturally rich.

I recently visited a beautiful beach, and it was an amazing experience! üåä The sound of the waves, the soft sand under my feet, and the cool sea breeze made it a perfect escape from the daily routine. The view during sunset was absolutely stunning ‚Äî calm and peaceful.

The beach was clean, and the atmosphere was very relaxing. I enjoyed walking along the shore, collecting shells, and just watching the waves roll in. If you‚Äôre looking for a place to unwind and connect with nature, I definitely recommend visiting this beach.

Marina Beach is Chennai‚Äôs most famous tourist attraction, and it‚Äôs easy to see why. As the longest natural urban beach in the country, it offers a picturesque setting with its silver sand, blue sea, and stunning sunrise and sunset views. However, there are a few things to keep in mind:
Undercurrents: While the beach is beautiful, the undercurrents can be strong, making it challenging for swimmers. It‚Äôs essential to exercise caution and stay safe.
Kannagi Statue: Look out for the ‚ÄúKannagi‚Äù statue, which tells the story of the legendary character from a South Indian epic. It adds a cultural touch to the beach experience.

Duration: Plan to spend 2-3 hours at Marina Beach. Whether you‚Äôre taking a leisurely stroll, enjoying the sea breeze, or simply relaxing, there‚Äôs something for everyone.

Amenities: Nearby, you‚Äôll find amenities like parking, restaurants, and showers. These facilities enhance the overall experience for visitors.

Marina Beach is a must-visit spot in Chennai, offering a blend of natural beauty, history, and local culture

Restaurants & Cafes: The area around the beach is home to many famous eateries like Murugan Idli Shop, Jonah‚Äôs Bistro, and Mash Resto Caf√©.

However, be mindful of rising vendor clutter and occasional sanitation concerns. Overall, it‚Äôs a top choice for a relaxed day out, especially in the mornings or evenings.

Best experience you can get here. We went on a weekday and it‚Äôs more quieter than marina beach during night. Nice walking path in the beach and it‚Äôs clean. There is also skating park for kids.

Besant Nagar Beach is a wonderful spot to visit. While the beachfront is relatively small, the area is moderately clean and well-maintained. It boasts a wide range of food options, from local street vendors to popular multi-level restaurant chains, offering a variety of cuisines to enjoy.

Besant Nagar Beach is a wonderful spot to visit and truly a delightful experience. The beach is clean, the atmosphere is calm, and the streets nearby are filled with amazing street food that adds to the charm. The park area with its various rides is also worth exploring and makes the visit even more enjoyable. The only drawback is the presence of persistent beggars and vendors, which can be bothersome, so it‚Äôs good to stay cautious. Other than that, Besant Nagar Beach is definitely a must-visit destination in Chennai.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Bessie Beach, is hands down one of my favorite places in Chennai. I‚Äôve been visiting it regularly ‚Äì both early in the mornings and late at night, and each visit has something special to offer.

üåÖ Sunrise at the beach is a serene and beautiful experience. The soft golden light, the gentle sound of waves, and the cool breeze instantly lift your mood. It‚Äôs the perfect time to go for a peaceful walk or just sit by the shore and soak in the calmness before the city wakes up.

üåá Sunset, on the other hand, brings its own charm. The sky turns into a canvas of oranges and pinks, and the atmosphere becomes livelier with people strolling, kids playing, and street food vendors lighting up the beachside. There‚Äôs something so refreshing and calming about the place, no matter what time of day it is. The moment you step onto the sand, you feel a sense of peace and lightness that only the sea can bring.

üéâ One of the exciting things about Bessie is that they screen IPL matches on big screens during the season! It adds a vibrant community vibe, with people cheering, relaxing with friends and family, and enjoying snacks while watching the game in the open air with the sea breeze around.

Whether you‚Äôre looking for quiet reflection during sunrise, chilling with friends in the evening, or even just grabbing a bite from the food stalls, Besant Nagar Beach never disappoints. It‚Äôs clean, lively, and safe, and has become a sort of personal escape zone for me within the city.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Chennai or even locals who haven‚Äôt made this part of their regular routine yet!

Watching the sunrise at Besant Nagar Beach is truly magical. Basant Nagar Beach is one of those places where the city‚Äôs chaos fades away, replaced by the calming rhythm of the waves. Whether you visit at dawn, when the sky blushes softly, or in the evening under the moonlit glow, the place feels magical. reviews.reviewText:
Presidency College is an arts, law and science college in the city of Chennai in Tamil Nadu, India. Established as the Madras Preparatory School on October 15, 1840 and later, upgraded to a high school and then, graduate college, the Presidency College is one of the oldest government arts colleges in India. It is one of the two Presidency colleges established by the British in India, the other being the Presidency College, Kolkata.. At the behest of Sir Thomas Munro, a Committee of Public Instruction was formed in 1826. In 1836, the duties of the Committee were taken over by a "Committee of Native Education". The plans drawn up by the Committee did not commend themselves to the Governor of Madras, Lord Elphinstone, who in turn proposed nineteen resolutions which were passed unanimously.[1]
As first Principal, the choice of Elphinstone fell on E. B. Powell, a University of Cambridge Wrangler in Mathematics, who accepted the post. Powell reached Mumbai (Bombay) on 20 September 1840 but did not arrive at Chennai (Madras) until 24 November, the journey from Bombay to Madras taking some four weeks. In the mean time, the Committee had invited a Mr Cooper, from the Hoogly College, Kolkata (Calcutta), to carry out the duties of Principal temporarily, at a salary of Rs. 400 a month. Cooper accepted the invitation and came to Chennai (Madras). He and his staff opened Presidency School, a preparatory school, in a rented building in Egmore known as Edinburgh Home on 15 October 1840. Cooper remained in the preparatory school for only a few months. Soon after Eyre Burton Powell's arrival and before the opening of the high school department in April 1841, he returned to Kolkata (Calcutta). The preparatory School was shifted to Popham's Broadway in 1841.[1]
The schools grew into Presidency College. When the University of Madras was founded in 1857, Presidency College was affiliated to it.[1]
In 1870, the college moved to its present location in Kamaraj Salai, opposite Marina Beach.. One of the best college in Chennai. Most of the Eminent people are studied here
India's most Heritage and 3rd ranked college 184 year old
Near chepauk

My Favourite spot in Chennai.
Morning sunrise view is an Eye Catchy.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Edward Elliot's Beach is one of the most popular and serene beaches in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Located in the upscale neighborhood of Besant Nagar, this beach is a favorite spot for locals and tourists looking for a peaceful seaside experience.

Highlights

Scenic Beauty: A clean and less crowded alternative to Marina Beach, offering beautiful sunrise and sunset views.

Restaurants & Cafes: The area around the beach is home to many famous eateries like Murugan Idli Shop, Jonah‚Äôs Bistro, and Mash Resto Caf√©.

The nearby Ashtalakshmi Temple and Velankanni Church attract visitors for spiritual experiences.

A great place for morning or evening walks, jogging, or just relaxing by the sea.

I recently visited Besant Nagar Beach, and I must say, it's one of the most beautiful and serene beaches I've ever been to! Located in the heart of Chennai, this beach is a tranquil oasis that's perfect for a relaxing day out.

Cleanliness and Maintenance:
The beach is actually clean and well-maintained.

Scenic Views:
The beach offers breathtaking views of the Bay of Bengal, especially during sunrise and sunset. The picturesque Elliot's Promenade, which runs along the beach, is perfect for a leisurely walk or jog.

Food and Drink Options:
There are plenty of food stalls and restaurants nearby, offering a range of delicious food options and other local cuisine. Don't forget to try some of the fresh coconut water and local snacks!

Overall Experience:
Besant Nagar Beach is an absolute must-visit if you're in Chennai! Whether you're looking to relax, take a leisurely walk, or simply enjoy the scenic views, this beach has something for everyone.

Tips and Recommendations

- Best time to visit: Early morning or late evening to avoid the crowds and heat.
- Wear comfortable clothing and footwear, and don't forget your sunscreen and sunglasses!
- Try some of the local food options at the nearby restaurants.
- Be mindful of your belongings and personal safety, especially during peak hours.

What a temple is this. Loved this. I went this weekend and found one of the beautiful temple. I feel that the temple needs so more cleaning and hygiene due to huge crowd and will work better than now. I really felt blessed to get a chance to visit these places.

The Parthasarathy Temple in Triplicane is one of Chennai‚Äôs most treasured spiritual landmarks. It is one of the 108 Divya Desams. Built in the 8th century by the Pallavas, this temple radiates divinity and preserves the city‚Äôs deep cultural and devotional heritage.

The presiding deity here is Lord Parthasarathy (Krishna as the charioteer of Arjuna). Within the complex you‚Äôll also find shrines of Yoga Narasimha, Lord Rama with Sita and Lakshmana, Lord Lakshmi Ranganatha, Lakshmi Varadaraja, Vedavalli Thayar, and the revered Alwars. The experience is like visiting multiple temples at once, each radiating its own unique energy.

What to Expect:

Atmosphere: Serene yet lively, with devotional chants and the fragrance of incense filling the air.

Parking:Ample space is available for both 2-wheelers and 4-wheelers, which makes visiting convenient even during busy hours.

Shops:Right outside the temple, you‚Äôll find plenty of shops selling traditional items, including vastrams (clothes for vigrahas), flowers, and puja essentials‚Äîperfect if you want to take something back for your home deity.

Photography:Do note that photography is not allowed inside the temple, helping preserve its sanctity.
Nearby Attractions: The iconic Marina Beach is just about 700 meters away, making it easy to combine your spiritual visit with a walk by the sea.

üôè
The Parthasarathy Temple is a place of worship and journey into Chennai‚Äôs soul. Whether you are a devotee, a lover of history, or simply someone seeking peace, this temple is worth experiencing.

‚≠ê Recommended for: Families, devotees, history lovers, and anyone who wants to soak in authentic Chennai tradition.

Arulmigu Sri Parthasarathyswamy Temple ‚Äì Triplicane, Chennai

Visited this ancient temple in central Chennai and was deeply moved by its spiritual ambiance and rich heritage. Here's what stood out:

History & Architecture

One of Chennai‚Äôs oldest surviving temples, originally built by the Pallavas in the 6th‚Äì8th century, then expanded by the Cholas and later Vijayanagara kings  .

A proud Divya Desam, praised in the Naalayira Divya Prabandham by the Alvars  .

Features classic Dravidian structure: towering Raja Gopuram, ornate stone pillars, 36-pillared mandapam, and detailed carvings  .

Multiple Forms of Perumal

Central shrine houses Lord Parthasarathy (Krishna‚ÄìCharioteer of Arjuna), unique with a moustache (‚ÄúMeesai Perumal‚Äù) and holding only a conch (no discus), believed to bear Bheeshma‚Äôs arrow scars from Kurukshetra  .

Other shrines honor Yoga Narasimha, Rama, Gajendra Varadaraja, and Ranganatha, making it a revered Panchamurthi sthalam  .

Meesai Perumal & Variants

The moustached form is an iconic visual; during certain days of Vaikunta Ekadasi, he's shown without a moustache, symbolizing humility  .

The temple also includes a distinct shrine for Yoga Narasimha, with its own entrance and dhvajastambha  .
Prasadam

The Ven Pongal served here is particularly sweet and rich, made with extra ghee and cashews‚Äîbelieved to soothe the deity's arrow wounds  .

Common temple prasadam like Puliyodarai is also loved by devotees  .

Location & Atmosphere

Situated in the heart of Triplicane, just a few minutes from Marina Beach, yet it feels like a peaceful oasis  .

Real devotees comment on its positive aura, dedicated priests, and well-maintained grounds  .

Festivals & Events

Major celebrations include Chittirai Brahmotsavam, Vaikunta Ekadasi, and the Masi (February‚ÄìMarch) Theppam (float festival) in the temple tank  .

The annual Ramanujar festival is significant‚Äîlegend says his father performed a Putrakameshti yagna here and received the blessing that Ramanuja would be born  .

Summary

A divine blend of ancient architecture, living tradition, and deep Vaishnava devotion‚Äîthis temple is high on my list for anyone seeking spiritual depth or historical richness in Chennai. The sight of Meesai Perumal, the serene tank, and the lusciously sweet prasadam make it unforgettable.

An amazing experience. I'm not a religious person but the collective chanting of the mantras and the architectural beauty was enchanting. Whenever you visit Chennai, try this place at least once. You'll get inner peace.
Ancient Hindu Heritage temple. Spectacular South-Indian architecture. The priests are helpful and polite there. Good spiritual and devotional place with peaceful atmosphere.

It's a beautiful temple.of Lord Parthasarathy and Goddess Rukimni. Satyaki's idol is to the left.of Lord Parthasarathy. The speciality is that Lord Parthasarathy has a moustache. He looks cute

There are also temples of Goddess Mahalakshmi and Andal in the premises.

Must see

The Parthasarathy Temple, nestled in the vibrant Triplicane area of Chennai, is an absolute must-visit for anyone seeking a blend of spiritual tranquility, historical richness, and architectural of the oldest temples in Chennai, dedicated to Lord Krishna (as Parthasarathy, the charioteer of Arjuna), it offers a truly immersive experience.

From the moment you step through its towering gopuram, you are enveloped in an atmosphere of devotion. The intricate carvings on the pillars and walls tell tales from Hindu mythology, showcasing the exquisite craftsmanship of the Pallava and later Chola and Vijayanagara periods. The vibrant colors of the deities and the constant chanting of hymns create a serene and uplifting ambiance.

What truly sets this temple apart is its unique dedication to five forms of Vishnu: Krishna (Parthasarathy), Rama, Ranganatha, Gajendra Varadaraja, and Narasimha. Each shrine is beautifully maintained, allowing devotees to offer prayers and admire the distinct iconography. The main deity, Lord Parthasarathy, with his iconic mustache and scars from the Mahabharata war, is particularly captivating.

The temple complex is surprisingly spacious and well-organized, making it easy to navigate. Don't miss the opportunity to witness the daily rituals and aarti, which are performed with great devotion and precision. The spiritual energy during these times is palpable.

Beyond its religious significance, the Parthasarathy Temple is a living testament to South Indian heritage. It's a place where history breathes, art flourishes, and faith resonates deeply. Must visit temple in chennai.

The temple and place is simply divine and awesome. It‚Äôs a bliss to be part of the community and lovely experience of darshans of Parthasarathy Perumal, Narashimar , SriRanganathar, SriKanchiVaradhar and SriRamar swamy.
Also the temple has Goddess Ranganayaki , Vedavalli and Andal thayar.

reviews.reviewText: The Tiger cave is a nice set of stone carvings and statues. A different set or one could call it a fresh set of work in comparison to the rest of the statues and stone carvings in Mahabalipuram. It's not crowded at all and would be nice to take images without much disturbance from too many people. It has a tiny beach in its backyard if at all one wants to check out the sea too.

The 1st site & is less visited site when coming from Chennai.
It surely is underrated. Tiger cave has tigers all around it and elephants on its right side. There are also huge rock formations and a small cave temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It also has inscriptions on its walls.

Well maintained by ASI with gardens and the other side exit opens to the beach ‚õ±Ô∏è.
Well maintained. Amazing to think it‚Äôs been standing since the 1400s. Doesn‚Äôt take long to walk around. Good for a quick visit. No written info about the site so good to look up in advance.

This place is a few kilometres away from the main city. The entry ticket is Rs 25 per person. The place is huge and very beautiful. There you can see the carving of a monolith rock. The place is nice and beautiful. However, I felt there were lots of people selling food and the place was losing its beauty. There is an entrance to the beach from this place at th back. It is so depressing to see that the whole place is so dirty. Left overs of food and plastic has ruined the place. Too many shops. The beach has lost its charm.
Beautiful artifacts from the Pallava era. The entry was ‚Çπ25.  Toilet was locked out.  There is an access to beach.  Please bring enough water and snacks as you need.  There are no stores inside.

For the many years I have been in Chennai, it has been very sad on my part to have missed this part of Mamallapuram.

The site is well kept. Please do not miss the Arumugam Temple that was excavated and lies just outside the chain fence in the north. The temple is closed off and can be circled. A wonderful discovery. If the gate to that area is closed, one could walk from the beach or from ECR. Uniquely this temple has parts made from brick unlike the stone that is used to make the various other temples, caves etc.
Nice place to visit. There is a beach access. Few stalls conducting kids games. Tiger caves is clean and well maintained. The place will be closed by 5:30 PM

Place has tiger heads made using rock carvings.  Neatly maintained place, has large parking area. It has a toilet facility outside of the park.
There is a small gate backside of this park which takes one to a small beach.
There are small vendors that offer water, juice, snacks, etc outside the park. But there is no eatery for proper meal. So plan accordingly.
If you are interested in such rock cut places or interested in history, it's a good place to visit. Otherwise, it's a ok place for spending 1-2 hours.

Elliots Beach is an ideal spot for picnics or simply unwinding amidst beautiful natural surroundings.

placeMetadata.description: Former ice store where Swami Vivekananda stayed in 1897, now a permanent exhibition on his life.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vivekananda House, formerly an ice store, is now a permanent exhibition showcasing the life of Swami Vivekananda. This marshmallow-pink pavilion served as a meditation space for the renowned monk during his stay in 1897. Located on Marina Beach Road in Chennai, it holds significance as one of the historical places in the city. Visitors can explore Swami Vivekananda's chambers and view exhibits featuring photos from his tours of America.
placeMetadata.address: VIVEKANANDA HOUSE, Kamaraj Salai, Marina Beach Road, Triplicane, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600005, India

reviews.reviewText: Vivekananda House is a must-visit heritage site in Chennai, rich with history and spiritual significance. The place beautifully preserves the legacy of Swami Vivekananda and offers a peaceful, inspiring atmosphere. The exhibits are well-organized and informative, showcasing his life, teachings, and his historic stay here. The meditation room is especially calming, perfect for quiet reflection. Located right by the Marina Beach, it‚Äôs a great spot for both tourists and locals who are interested in culture and philosophy. Highly recommended!

I recently visited Vivekananda House and had an inspiring experience. The place is well-maintained and beautifully showcases the life and teachings of Swami Vivekananda. One of the highlights of my visit was the 4D VR show, which took us through Swami Vivekananda's powerful and spiritual journey in a truly immersive way.

The visuals, sound, and storytelling were amazing‚Äîit felt like I was walking alongside him through different phases of his life, especially his journey to the West and his speech at the Parliament of Religions in Chicago. It gave me a deeper understanding of his vision, thoughts, and contribution to Indian philosophy.

Overall, it's a must-visit place for anyone interested in history, spirituality, or just looking for inspiration. I left the place feeling motivated and proud of our rich cultural heritage.

Everything was excellent‚ú®üòÅ
1. Ambiance
2. 4D Movie with excellent Bass and effects
3. Virtual Reality experience was top notch
4. Photo with Swami Vivekananda felt special
5. Meditation room was divine
6. AC was very good

All comes with a very affordable price of ‚Çπ 50/-

If you are in Chennai a must watch place for all. Just spend 1 hour and give it a tryü§©üëçüí´‚ú®

Situated opposite to the Marina Beach. This is like a museum of Swami Vivekananda, where you can see the photos with the timelines of his life.

Very neatly maintained. There are are couple of theatres inside the museum where his Chicago speech, his early life are been portrayed. It will take some time in order to visit the museum. There is also a mediation hall where you can sit and meditate which is described as the place where he used to meditate when he came to Chennai.

They do have a bookstore where they sell his books. The ticket charges ‚Çπ50 per head. They will also take a photo free of cost and can be downloaded from the link they provide.

Fabulous experience. INR 50 per head for the entire activity. Excellent conduct by staff. In this cost you will get a walk around,3D,VR presentations + meditation time. This is all about swami vivekananda teachings,history,his speech at America. Parking is free. Must visit if you are near to marina beach. Thank me later. No other hidden fees

It‚Äôs a great place with high spiritual vibes.
There is a Meditation room, a VR room where you can see Swami Vivekananda‚Äôs story till he went to Chicago.
There is a 3D theatre which shows the Swami Vivekananda‚Äôs speech at world religious parliament in Chicago.
You can feel Swamiji‚Äôs aura present in this room when you meditate.
The entry ticket is only 50‚Çπ, which I feel is very nominal.
Outside there is a book stall also they run few yoga and spiritual courses as well.
You can see the Marina beach from the top floor. It has got a beautiful view.
Had a great experience!
I would highly recommend visiting this place.

Vivekananda House ‚Äì Marina, Chennai

For me, Vivekananda House has always been a landmark of Marina Beach. I‚Äôve been seeing this place from outside for more than 25 years, since my childhood, as it is close to my grandfather‚Äôs house. Whenever I go across Marina, this pink building always stands out and reminds me of its cultural and historical significance.

Though many people visit inside for school trips, exhibitions, or spiritual visits to learn about Swami Vivekananda and experience peace, the outside itself has a charm. Recently, opposite Vivekananda House, they have started putting up a big screen for open-air Tamil movie screenings, where the crowd sits together to watch evergreen films. The atmosphere becomes lively, with nearby stalls selling hot crispy bhajjis, ice creams, seafood like fish and prawn, fried rice, sodas, and popcorn ‚Äì giving a true Chennai beachside vibe.

This place beautifully balances heritage and modern leisure ‚Äì inside for culture and spirituality, and outside for entertainment and food. Truly, Vivekananda House is not just a building but a symbol of Marina itself.

Swami Vivekananda stayed in the building when he visited Chennai in 1897, and it was later renamed in his honor.
The place where swami stayed is today converted as a meditation hall, which is very calm and pleasant

Paintings are too good üòä
Exactly on Marina beach road, can get scenic beach views
VR, 3d show was superb

reviews.reviewText: Great place for families, couples and friends. Crowd control was good. Kids will definitely enjoy. But poor safety measures. Especially the ray fish sections. Parents keep your kids with you all the time.,

Dry rides are kinda ok ,there was only less variety of water games
Tickets are of Rs.850
There is a food court inside and the prices are too high. ( curd rice for Rs.85 )
Restrooms needed improvement, specially the changing room. Most of rides are not active in the afternoon but in evening. Evening vgp rides with lights are so good to see . Overall it was goodüëç

It is a wonderful and peaceful place. I will try again. It is a great place to go here and get peace of mind. You should try to go here with your family.I was here getting ready the whole day and I didn‚Äôt even realize the time.This is not an emotional park, this is a haven, it will fill your heart with happiness. It is a very good place.You should also go with your family. This is a very good place. I will give you five star feedback from my side. This place is very good.

Majority of the rides were not working when I went. And all other rides were not upto the level. I don't know what their maintenance dept is doing. But it had a nice water park. You can enjoy a day with your family and friends.

VGP Marine Kingdom in Chennai offers an incredible experience, especially with its 70-meter underwater tunnel. Walking through this tunnel, surrounded by diverse marine life swimming overhead, was truly mesmerizing. The aquarium is well-maintained and showcases a variety of aquatic species, making it a delightful visit for both adults and children.

My friends and I had a great time at VGP Universal Kingdom! Although some of the main rides were under maintenance due to recent incidents, the experience was still amazing. A few new rides have been opened, and they were absolutely thrilling. The highlight of our visit was the wave pool ‚Äî the DJ kept the energy high, and we spent most of our time enjoying the waves and the water rides. Overall, a fun and refreshing day!.

Best place to spend your holidays with your family and friends. We had a wonderful experience. Kids were thoroughly enjoyed riding  and water parks.

For playing in water games, you have to wear tshirt,  you can bring your own tshirt or  can buy tshirt from there for Rs.100 each. Better to bring your own tshirt, shower cap.

Small birds park also there. You can feed them.

If you bring snacks and lunch with you can spend your whole day. It's very hot during this summer, so cap is must.

We went on weekend only, not much crowded.

Worth for money.

Weekends are fully packed. There is alot of dry and wet activities in the park. Tickets are priced at 850 INR. There is alot of improvement required, the water gets dirty and there is so much dirt in the water. The water activities, the balloon seater is less compared to the crowd, you may have to wait a very long time. Bathroom also need improvement, specially the changing room. Most of rides are out of order or not active. Overall it is good to spend the day.

Located in a residential area should be difficult to locate but do visit if you are a creative person. The space for discussion and hanging out will encourage you to spend more time here.

One my favourite publishing houses in India. The collection of books and art forms they have got is soo unique. I was Soo happy to visit the store in person after purchasing their books online from many years now.

During my visit, I got a chance to interact with Mr. Helmut Wolf who showed few videos of the making of Tara books. And it was lovely of the staff Ms. Sudha who was there to explain about the art forms and the books we are interested in.
It was a wonderful visit. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.
Local bookshop that hosts artist residencies and encourages promotion of art styles from around India. Great selection of notebooks from artist prints that are one-of-a-kind and excellent gifts.
A gem of a bookshop, full of beautiful and delightful books, cards, notebooks and prints. It has a cosy reading nook, just no cafe as yet.
It's a really nice place. You can know how indian produce books in traditional way. And free guide for their building. Really beautiful and high quality art pieces.
Variety of Childrens books, manufactured in handmade papers, screen printing,  various language, colourful,  creative design and excellent work in books.

Absolutely beautiful, unique items by an above-and-beyond ethical business. Definitely worth a stop. Great for art prints, greeting cards, and a variety of journals in both size and style. VERY worth the price.
It's a beautiful little studio of books and art, and the worlds that the two bring with them. It's a must visit for any lover of aesthetics too!

reviews.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with such warmth and hospitality. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, always greeting us with a smile and ensuring every little detail was taken care of. The property itself is beautiful and peaceful ‚Äî the perfect escape with stunning views and cozy vibes.

Special thanks to the Kaini for her impeccable service and for making our stay feel so personal and memorable. We‚Äôre taking back lovely memories and can‚Äôt wait to return. Highly recommended!

The location is excellent‚Äîright by the sea with sweeping views and a calm, relaxing atmosphere.

Staff were warm, courteous, and helpful throughout the stay. Service felt personal and welcoming.

The beach access is a real plus, though it depends on tide and weather conditions. When open, it‚Äôs perfect for a morning walk or evening stroll.

The pool, gardens, and open spaces are beautifully maintained and ideal for unwinding.

Food was enjoyable, especially the fresh seafood. The open-air dining setup adds to the experience.

A peaceful retreat. Worth visiting if you‚Äôre looking for quiet time by the coast.

Taj Fisherman‚Äôs Cove is a beautiful property with a classic charm. Though it is an older resort, it has been maintained well and feels welcoming. The food is absolutely delicious, and overall service is very good.

However, there were a couple of drawbacks. The moment you enter the room, there is an unpleasant smell from the toilet, which seems to be a plumbing issue that really needs attention. Also, while the hotel is beachfront, the beach itself isn‚Äôt particularly great, so don‚Äôt expect that to be the highlight of your stay.

Taj Fisherman‚Äôs Cove is hands down one of the most peaceful and relaxing stays I‚Äôve experienced. From the moment you arrive, the sound of the ocean and the lush greenery set the tone for a perfect coastal escape.

What made it even more special was that it‚Äôs pet-friendly! It‚Äôs such a relief to find a luxury resort that warmly welcomes pets without compromising on comfort or service. The staff is incredibly warm, and the property is spacious enough for pets to roam freely in a safe, natural setting.

The cottages and sea-view rooms offer ultimate privacy, and the vibe throughout the resort is calm and rejuvenating‚Äîideal for a break from city life. Whether it‚Äôs lounging by the beach, enjoying a spa session, or just soaking in the serenity, this place delivers on all fronts.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind with their furry companion in a five-star coastal retreat.

I stayed here for 3 days with family. Property and location is great. There is so much to do plus relax as well. What made this stay great was staff. Sheelan( if I for name right) as seagull restaurant was great and food was amazing.

Same goes for manager who handles breakfast, great staff and fantastic food (specially bakery).

We stayed in a Garden View Room and had the best experience with our 3-month-old baby. The beach was just a short walk from our room‚Äîclean, peaceful, and perfect for a quick stroll.

The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the food had a wide variety that was satisfying for all tastes. The pool experience was amazing, helping us truly relax during our stay.

It was a peaceful, family-friendly place that made traveling with a baby feel easy. We‚Äôll definitely come again soon!

Recently stayed in fisherman cove resort for 2 days. Exceptional service by the staff around. I would like to specially mention chef Mr. John . I was bit sick and was not able to eat anything when I reached the resort. Just seeing my dull face , Chef John understood I was not ok. His kindness shone through. With a warm smile, he made fresh Idiyappam and coconut milk specially for me and he made yummiest home style curd rice  showcasing a motherly touch that went beyond just cooking. His thoughtful gesture helped me recover quickly and I was all ok by evening. I am deeply grateful for his compassion and thought fullness. I could enjoy my birthday at the resort. Would love to visit again  for the peaceful Private beach and the yummy food and room facilities at the resort . Taj resorts that way hold special place in our hearts ..

Review for corporate team outing

We haven't utilised rooms so i wont review on this. The resort was spacious and greenish but the problem is the behaviour of securities. Managers were good but they have north india guys as securities they just treat us like trespassers. Wherever we go they follow us and question us. Only word they were taught was this is only for guest. We understand we might not have access to few places and that can be conveyed in decent way not like this. Management should train the securities to treat people in the equal way though they pay for premium rooms or they pay for party halls. They don't just visit free.

reviews.reviewText:
It is an amazing place to visit with family with friends.. has got an amazing ambiance, and there are people to explain new stuff.If you were curious..
It was actually my second time going there and I would love to go there again!
Well maintained aquarium and you can go see the sharks and all different types of fishes. Its cool-!! They've got VR and also a cool store at the end ( which might be a little overpriced thoüòÇ )

Immerse into an aquatic world filled with fascinating sea creatures:

Great experience. It has 5 kingdoms.

At the beginning, you will feel the entry fees is too high and it‚Äôs not worth it.

But as you enter the ocean and deep ocean kingdom, you will be fascinated by the variety of aquatic life.

Star fish moving slowly‚Ä¶..Nemo fish living happily with sea animals.

Sharks‚Ä¶.Sting Rays‚Ä¶.Wow‚Ä¶.It gets exciting.

Plan to spend more time in ocean and deep ocean area.

Photography is bit expensive - Rs.350 per photo. Snacks like popcorn is expensive too.

Since we went there near 4 pm, we were also fortunate to deep the scuba divers in the feeding show. Diver feeds all the big fish in a fascinating 10-15 minutes show.

Book a day in advance to avail discounts.

One or two staff are helpful and they explain everything nicely. Try to stay with them and you will be amazed at the beauty of the deep sea.

An Unforgettable Scuba Diving Experience at VGP Marine Kingdom!

I had my first scuba diving experience here, and it was absolutely unforgettable! The trainers were incredibly patient and professional. Before heading into the main pool, they spent around 30 minutes training me, helping me get comfortable with the equipment‚Äîespecially breathing in and out through the mouth, which was a bit tricky at first.

Once I was ready, diving into the pool surrounded by sharks and bat rays was nothing short of thrilling. It genuinely felt like being in the real ocean, with the presence of these majestic and slightly intimidating creatures all around. It was definitely worth every rupee I spent!

One of the most fascinating parts was watching the team feed the fishes manually. They carried buckets of fish right up to the sharks and other species, feeding them with such confidence‚Äîit was a jaw-dropping sight!

Special thanks to¬†Prabhamani¬†from the call center for her fabulous support, and¬†indhu¬†at the Marine Kingdom for being so helpful throughout. The entire scuba team deserves applause for making this a safe and exciting adventure.

Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a unique underwater experience!

Review:

VGp Marine Kingdom is a wonderful underwater experience! The fish tanks are clean and well maintained, showcasing a wide variety of vibrant marine life. The highlight is the stunning glass tunnel ‚Äî it truly feels like walking under the sea. Don‚Äôt miss the 15-minute real mermaid show ‚Äî it‚Äôs magical and adds a unique touch to the visit. Great place for families and ocean lovers!

* Totally AC inside
* Ticket price is a bit on the higher side (‚Çπ745 Adult , 645 Kids)
But available on discount online.

If you are interested in seeing a variety of ocean fishes then you will enjoy it. Kids will enjoy there is a mermaid show too that will also be enjoyed by kids while we are going i saw an early bird offer on the site that is if you book the tickets prior one day you will 750 worth ticket for 550 so just check before the site before planning to this place. This is my personal opinion

We really enjoyed the visit ‚Äî the aquarium was well-maintained, and the variety of beautiful fish and marine life was impressive. The kids had a fantastic time exploring. Entire staff is quite friendly and guides the path etc . Special mention YAGU for giving little insight about marine life . However, the mermaid attire and photo shoot options were quite expensive, which was a bit of a downside for families with kids. Overall not too tiring and a fun outing .

I spent nearly half a day at VGP Marine Kingdom, and from the moment I stepped in, it truly felt like I had entered a different world.

The entire space is air-conditioned, which is such a relief especially in Chennai‚Äôs heat making it a great spot to visit any time of the year, even during peak summer.

The ambiance is beautifully maintained clean, aesthetic, and thoughtfully designed. Every corner feels polished and inviting, which makes it appealing to people of all ages. You can easily spend an entire day here, slowly exploring the exhibits and discovering fish and marine life you‚Äôve probably never seen before.

It was a peaceful, enriching experience overall.

Highly recommended for families, kids, and anyone looking for a relaxed outing with a touch of wonder!

Absolutely stunning. No words. The tunnel was brilliant. Lots of fun activities, things, stores, but the the food court was not so good. very dirty, stray dogs here and there, many stalls closed, too expensive, etc. But would recommend it.

reviews.reviewText: I would recommend this place to anyone who loves carting. Coming from bangalore the prices here are cheaper and the carts r in good condition too. The tracks are small and one curve is really bumpy

Best place for Adventure Racing and Adult karting in chennai. Good place to chillout with friends gang. Tariff was quite higher but try atleast once for racing experience. Cafeteria hygiene need to be improved.

Karts are maintained in good condition.
If you are good at driving then go time based option. For beginners it‚Äôs good to choose lap based option for better experience.

Double seat kart is also available where one can drive and other can simply sit and enjoy the ride.

We visited on 2nd August 2025 between 3‚Äì4 PM. The crowd was less, but we still had to wait for around 45 minutes, as the waiting depends on how long previous players take for their rides.

We tried both twin kart and solo kart:

Twin kart: Extremely hard to turn, which made it quite painful to handle. Speed was decent, but the steering effort was too much.

Solo kart: Much better experience with smooth turns and good speed.

Waiting time: ~45 mins
Prices: Vary between weekdays and weekends.

Overall, it‚Äôs a fun place to enjoy if you‚Äôre prepared for some waiting.

Pretty cool place overall with a decent size track. A few minor things could really improve the whole experience. 1. They only take local India credit cards. Anyone visit from out of country must have enough cash. This posed a problem for our group. 2. Some vehicles worked better than others but the engine is so close with zero barrier, 2 people in our group got burned just trying to put their seatbelt on. 3. Hygiene of helmets and bathrooms could use more focus.

Visited ECR Speedway last week with a bunch of friends and had a great time overall! The track is fun, the vibe is energetic, and it‚Äôs a nice way to break out of routine and enjoy something different.

Only downside was the hygiene of the helmets‚Äîthey really need a refresh because the smell was quite off-putting. Would definitely suggest they improve that.

Apart from that, it‚Äôs a solid spot for some friendly racing and a fun outing with your group. Would go again (maybe with my own helmet next time üòÑ).

Had an amazing experience at ECR Speedways. The place is extremely well managed ‚Äî from the smooth booking process to the friendly and professional staff. The track is well maintained, and the karts are in great condition, making the whole experience super fun and safe. Definitely one of the best go-karting spots around! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a thrilling time

ECR Speedway ‚Äì Disappointing Experience with Staff Bias

Went to ECR Speedway excited to try the adult karts. The staff clearly told us that the age limit is 10+ for adult karts, and we were 11 and 13 years old, so we thought it was all good. But then they suddenly changed the reason and said we can‚Äôt ride because our legs might not reach the brakes, which made no sense ‚Äì we were clearly tall enough and even tried to show them.

To make it worse, they gave a kid‚Äôs kart to someone else who came after us and didn‚Äôt offer us the same option. No explanation, no proper reason. We were just made to sit in the twin kart, which wasn‚Äôt what we came for. Felt like straight-up favouritism and very unfair.

We went there to have fun but ended up feeling disappointed. The karts and track might be good, but the way the staff handled the situation was poor.

Not a great experience ‚Äì hope they treat all visitors fairly in the future.

placeMetadata.name: Church of Our Lady of Light (Luz Church)

sources.snippet: Styled with blue-and-white baroque elegance, pretty little palm-fringed Luz Church is Chennai's oldest European building, dating to 1516 ‚Äì which also‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Marina Beach | Chennai (Madras), India | Attractions

placeMetadata.description: Small 16th century Portuguese style Catholic church with a gilded interior & Madonna & child shrine.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Our Lady of Light Shrine, also known as Luz Church, is a small 16th-century Catholic church built in Portuguese style. The interior is adorned with gilded decorations and houses a shrine of Madonna and child. Renovated during British rule, the church still retains its original Portuguese architectural design. According to local folklore, Portuguese sailors were guided to shore by a bright white light during a storm at sea.
placeMetadata.address: 156, Luz Church Rd, CIT Colony, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004, India

reviews.reviewText:
Luz Church is also known as Our Lady of Light Church.
It is one of the oldest churches in Chennai, built by the Portuguese in 1516.
It is a beautiful blend of European and Indian architectural styles.
The church has a serene atmosphere, making it a peaceful place for prayer and reflection.
Despite being over 500 years old, it remains well-maintained and continues to be an important place of worship for the local Christian community.
It's one of the oldest church in chennai. It was built in 1516 and it got damaged twice and got rebuild. We can see the historical damaged stone in the church back side
One of the oldest churches in chennai. It was built in 1516. You can even see a tomb from 1637. It is a small beautiful church. A peaceful place to pray. Parking space available.

"Wow, what a beautiful and peaceful place! The Our Lady of Light Church is a stunning example of architecture and faith. The moment you step inside, you can feel the serenity and tranquility that fills the space. The stunning stained-glass windows, intricate details, and beautiful artwork create a sense of awe and wonder.

The community is warm and welcoming, and the services are always uplifting and inspiring. The church has a rich history and a strong sense of tradition, yet it also feels modern and inclusive.

Whether you're a local or just visiting, Our Lady of Light Church is a must-see destination. It's a place where you can connect with your faith, find peace and solace, and feel a sense of belonging.

A church with tremendous history and a must visit in Chennai.

Very quiet and quaint.

Please read up on its history on readily available sources.

Visited the church during a typical Saturday afternoon, it was peaceful, there was serenity, one could feel the calmness and comfort in the air and atmosphere inside.

A rich and historic place of worship which has been standing tall for over 500 years in the heart of chennai is a must visit place for anyone seeking for some peace. The place has ample parking spaces for both 2 wheelers and 4 wheelers and is easy to navigate and locate from the maps as well.

I happen to visit the place as I attended Christmas Service in 2023 by Kuki Worship Service, Chennai. The church is rich in its architecture and design. It look impressive. The church has Hall and dinner hall too. So I mean the church is well equipped with infrastructure and amenities. The place is also clean which adds my likeness to it.

Very Oldest church in Chennai 1572  good view and maintaining with all facilities function hall available with lots of parking and restroom lift facilities also available.
Very attractive golden color biggest church in Chennai. It's very peaceful and very quite.
It's near by Luz corner so much food court and purchase center also available.
Very good location and  Sunday very crowded area very clean hygienic place. Good  atmosphere and maintenance nice

reviews.reviewText: It was really a memorable and enjoyable day @ blue lagoon beach resort. I'm really admired by the place with safe children play park, beautiful swimming pool and breezy beach. The taste of the meal is really the best one. We enjoyed a lot. It is perfect place for a perfect day out

Very good resort at a great location. Have ample space for family / team activities with good parking. Have conducted and attended multiple events here. Rooms are not that great though. Food is fine, but not excellent or great. Service is good, but cannot except finesse. Swimming pool have to be booked in advance. Price is optimal. Overall good.

We had a family get together here. Our experience with the pool and water fall was awesome. Totally enjoyed it. Food was super delicious. Although there's a lot of crowd, everything was organised very well. Place is clean and hygienic. Service too was prompt and good. Overall a very good experience

Our office team outing was a great experience overall. We enjoyed playing various sports including cricket, volleyball, and badminton, which brought everyone together. The beach view was beautiful and added to the atmosphere of the day. While the food was decent, the event could have benefited from better organization and coordination. Despite the minor organizational issues, it was a memorable day that the team thoroughly enjoyed.

Visited for a day outing and had an overall pleasant experience. The food provided was tasty, though the selection was somewhat limited. The pool area stood out ‚Äî it was clean and well-maintained, perfect for faimly but the time felt limited. Common areas were also tidy and well-kept, contributing to a comfortable and welcoming environment. While a bit more variety in the food options would have enhanced the experience, it's still a great spot for a quick getaway or group outing.

We had our reunion at Blue Lagoon today. The support provided by the staff members was good. However there are certain areas which needs to be improved.

1) Food is very average. It is an non customisable menu. Buffet was served in a common area and more than 250+ people will have food with you during your slot. Good that they gave us seating in a row. Food is not good except very few items.. Chicken starter was soo hard. They give a very big menu, but reality it was not sumptuous.

2) Our team was allocated a lawn area for our gathering. Only chair facility was there. No water facility available, which is very basic necessity.

This is a beautiful and relaxing place that truly lives up to its name. Located right by the beach, the resort offers a peaceful atmosphere, lush greenery, and well-maintained surroundings that make it perfect for a weekend getaway or special occasion.

I recently visited the resort to attend a friend‚Äôs wedding held at their marriage hall. The venue was spacious, clean, and very well-organized. The decorations were beautifully done, and the beachside setting added a unique charm to the whole celebration. The staff were courteous and ensured the event ran smoothly.

The ambiance of the resort is calm and refreshing, with plenty of open space and beach access that makes it ideal for both events and leisure. It's a great place to unwind with family or friends, and also perfect for hosting memorable occasions like weddings or receptions.

We celebrated our daughter's birthday at Blue Lagoon Resort Neelankarai, we totally loved it. They offered us a open party area with lawn and other necessities. With their cleanliness, ambiance, space and services, that evening event was outstanding. Overall my kid had a great time and most significantly a delicious supper at reasonable cost.

reviews.reviewText:
Our recent stay at The Country Club Jade Beach Resort was an experience of pure comfort and relaxation. The room was spacious and well-appointed, providing a perfect sanctuary after a long day of activities. The resort's attention to guest comfort truly made us feel at home.
‚ÄãThe culinary offerings were exceptional, with the Bay Watch Restaurant providing a delightful multi-cuisine experience. We were also impressed with the range of facilities available, including the gym, swimming pool, and spa, all of which contributed to a holistic and rejuvenating stay.
‚ÄãThe resort's prime location on the Bay of Bengal beach stretch offers breathtaking views and easy access to local attractions. Its proximity to Mahabalipuram and Chennai makes it an ideal choice for both leisure and business travelers. The resort's dedicated banquet facilities also make it a popular venue for events and gatherings.
‚ÄãWe were particularly impressed by the efficiency and warmth of the front desk staff, who were always ready to assist with a smile. The availability of indoor games added to the recreational options. Overall, The Country Club Jade Beach Resort is a perfect getaway that combines excellent facilities with a serene environment, and we would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable stay.

Don't ever buy country club membership, my total money and time wasted. We had booked this resort for 2 days but staying there 1 day was very difficult, bed was dirty, bed sheets were smelling bad, room service was not good, food was worst, 2 stars for room as it was little spacious, other than that 1 star is also too much for everything else. They just want us to pay for everything but not hive service for anything. We should have booked a different resort for same price.

The place has kind of lost its yesteryear's glory. If only they could maintain the place better, they could be on the way to compete with the big wigs.
They served the buffet on the table as the number of people were less. That being said I'd give food a definite 4 stars- 1 star less as nobody is perfect ever.
The swimming pool was functional and we spent a considerable amount of time at the pool. The changing rooms require an overhaul. The private beach was good but they could maintain the surroundings better and control the entry of stray cows there.
The indoor games area can have better lighting and be beautified a bit more for aesthetics.
The children's play area too needs a major overhaul to have the place functional and safe for kids.

Lunch is okay, can't say its good. Swimming pool is not well maintained, the floor is broken, chances to injure your foot. Then after swimming pool shower facilities and bathroom is not hygiene. Indoor game area is very hot. Only one fan is there. Ac Is not working. Overall experience is not satisfied compared with our previous visit.

Rooms are not well maintained.
Food we liked it as it was less spicy and there are no side effects. Only con is we are bored of the food in the menu as we stayed for three days.
Service was good especially one anna in the cafe. He tried his best to understand our needs and served us.

Nice and cozy place. Family oriented place. The food was absolutely fabulous. The staff were very friendly. The pool is medium in size and got very crowded few times throughout the day. Very few indoor games, no A/C in the games area. Small park attached with basic playing amenities for kids. Reception area is quite hot to be in as it is not A/Ced. Good location and nice clean beach attached to the property. Worth a visit.

Nice place hangover with family and friends for a day. Swimming pool is well maintained.  Additional charges for using the pool, charging 100 for 2hrs is fine when compare to our local swimming pools inside the city. My kids were enjoyed in pool, park and beach. Provided free face painting washable was really nice, for kids and adults. Varieties are very less but worth for money since the charge is less compare to neighboring resorts.
All together it is good.

Experience was really good and the facilities was as promised. I had organized team outing for around 50 members and they provided free hall and the main highlight was food. It was really tasty and worth. Rest of the things depends on how we want to make use. They had few tents arranged for club members so if someone is looking to make use of such options it would be good for sure.

reviews.reviewText: We had an amazing team outing at this resort! The place is very spacious, with a beautiful lawn and a great selection of indoor and outdoor games. The food was absolutely top-notch, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian ‚Äì every dish was delicious. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful, ensuring we had a smooth and enjoyable experience. A special thanks to Jasmine ma‚Äôam, without whom this event wouldn‚Äôt have been possible. Highly recommend this place for a relaxing and fun getaway!

Very bad experience! The staff and even the resort manager were super rude, no respect for customers at all. There‚Äôs no proper lift service, and privacy is zero. Even after booking the whole bay, random people were coming in and roaming around ‚Äî we complained to the management but no one cared.

Maintenance is the worst! For room cleaning, we had to call 4-5 times, only then someone would show up. Same with the lift ‚Äî every single time it stopped working, we had to keep calling the operator again and again.

And the worst part ‚Äî during our event, the drainage near the food area was leaking! So unhygienic and disgusting. Honestly, such a horrible experience, totally not worth the money!

Perfect One-Day Family Getaway!
We stayed here for just one day with family and had a wonderful time! The resort is well-maintained, clean, and beautifully landscaped. The staff was polite and helpful from check-in to check-out.

The rooms were spacious, neat, and had all the essentials. The kids enjoyed the pool area, and we loved the peaceful nature vibes. The food was tasty and had good variety for both kids and adults.

It‚Äôs a great place for a short escape from the city, and perfect for families looking for a relaxing and fun day. Definitely coming back for a longer stay next time!

I had a truly pleasant stay at Green Coconut Resort. The ambiance was calm, quiet, and refreshing‚Äîperfect for a peaceful retreat from the city hustle. The surroundings were lush and well-maintained, offering a serene atmosphere that made the stay even more relaxing.

The staff was courteous and attentive, ensuring comfort throughout. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-equipped. I especially enjoyed the poolside and garden areas‚Äîideal for unwinding and soaking in the natural beauty.

Highly recommended for families, couples, or anyone looking to recharge in a tranquil setting.

Extremely Disappointing Stay ‚Äì Broken Commitments and Poor Service

We booked the entire property for a 3-day stay for the destination marriage, expecting a smooth and enjoyable experience based on the management‚Äôs commitments. Unfortunately, what we received was far from acceptable and caused significant inconvenience and embarrassment.

Despite booking the entire venue, we were shocked to discover that other guests had also been accommodated, causing major discomfort and overcrowding. The basic promise of daily linen and towel changes was completely ignored‚Äînot even a single change happened during our stay. they have only one small lift can accommodate two people at a time, event that also not worked properly.

The washrooms were in terrible condition: water flow was extremely slow, taps were broken, and faucets didn‚Äôt function properly. Even worse, we were denied access to the large swimming pool that was clearly advertised as available for guests.

One of the most frustrating issues was the complete failure to supply drinking water in the rooms as promised. With 74 rooms booked, not even one refill was done throughout the stay.

The decoration vendor caused damages, but strangely, we were asked to pay for it by unrelated parties like the green coconut supplier‚Äîabsolutely unprofessional and unfair.

We had also requested 3 wheelchairs for a large group of over 200 guests. Only one was provided, despite repeated reminders. We paid ‚Çπ60,000 per day for kitchen usage, yet it was poorly maintained, and the drainage area broke down during the event, leading to overflow and a horrible mess.

Staff behavior was another low point‚Äîthey were outright rude, used foul language in front of guests, and showed no sense of hospitality. Many rooms were dirty, had non-functioning air conditioning, broken power sockets, badly arranged furniture, and unwashed curtains.

To top it all, they promised 20 safety locks but didn‚Äôt hand over a single key. At the end, without delivering any of the promised services, they were aggressive and confrontational about payment.

Overall, this was an extremely disappointing and unprofessional experience. We expected hospitality, but were met with negligence and hostility. Not recommended.

Never stayed anywhere else in India before, so can't offer any comparison there, but this resort is just lovely. We came to attend a wedding being held on site, and I really just have nothing negative to say about the place at all. The room was very clean and nicely appointed, and the entire staff was friendly,  courteous, and attentive - from the groundskeepers, to the attendants at the front desk, to the wait staff at the restaurant, to the owners themselves. They even accommodated our evidently unusual fondness for black coffee. :)

Extremely Disappointing Stay

Our team recently stayed at your hotel in Room 402, and we had a highly disappointing experience. The air conditioning was completely non-functional, yet we were still charged for it. This made our stay extremely uncomfortable and inconvenient.

It is unacceptable to charge guests for services that are not provided. Based on our experience, we strongly do not recommend this hotel to anyone. We hope the management takes immediate steps to improve their facilities and service standards to avoid similar issues for future guests.

It is a mixture of good and good. Great ambiance with spacious rooms but the Rooms were not clean and WIFI was not working. The entire resort was huge and many activities are available for kids and adults.Since we complained about the room we were upgraded to a premium room. The food is good but slightly on the expensive side. The menu is exclusive to GST. It has a great potential to have a 5 star rating but there are let down as well.

reviews.reviewText: Gamemaster Aravind was very friendly and patient with the three 10 year olds we"d gone with. They loved the whole "lockout" experience and according to them, would rate it a million stars :)

Great place to hangout but fares are a bit high for just an hour. And it ends even before you do 1/3rd of the game. They shd either increase the time to 1.5 hrs or decrease the fare a bit. Plus no refreshments provided after paying 800 per hour. Nothing available either. Soft drinks are available which are charged separately . So I guess service and fares could be better

It was a really fun experience. We played cabin in the woods with a few of our friends. Abhimanue sir, our host was the most patient yet enthusiastic person I've met, and out game master, muthu sir was very helpful to us. The puzzles are quite difficult, which I appreciate alot. Perfect for special occasions :)

Very terrible experience with Mystery Rooms Nungambakkam.

We had booked the ‚ÄúHangover‚Äù theme for 5 persons the day before. Got an email saying we‚Äôd receive a call to confirm our booking but never got one - so we called ourselves and they confirmed.

However, upon reaching, they said there was a technical difficulty and the game was
unavailable since yesterday night - they didn‚Äôt even care to inform us even when we called 30 mins before. They did not have any other theme available either - we drove over 15 km for absolutely nothing. They only gave excuses and tried to make us go away.

Incredibly poor customer service - wouldn‚Äôt recommend to anybody who wants to rest assured that they‚Äôve made a booking and will be let in.

This place is awesome. We have tried two of the rooms till now, the lockout and a night in bhangarh. They were both really challenging and made us really use our heads. Especially bhangarh, which was a dark room puzzle. The effects plus the puzzles kept us super invested. Plus the staff here are so friendly and helpful. It was a joy to experience the rooms and we can't wait to try out the other rooms

One of the best mystery rooms in Chennai. Played 2 of their games and absolutely loved it. The staff are very helpful and make the whole experience that much more enjoyable! Definitely going back for more.
AMAAAZING EXPERIENCE. Went for A Night in Bhangarh and Cabin in the Woods... Surya and Praveen Kumar guided us through the two games we played. Was just awesome!! We are coming back again for sure

The mystery room is experience was an awesome experience. We went in a team of two and it was 1 hours of brainstorming and fun throughout. I thank the host Abhimanyu and the host Muthu for arranging such an awesome experience.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chennai Citi Centre is a premier destination for leisure, entertainment, and shopping in the heart of Chennai. It offers a wide array of shopping, dining, and entertainment experiences. Situated near popular tourist attractions like Marina Beach and Kapaleeswarar Temple, it's a favored spot for tourists seeking leisure activities. placeMetadata.address: 10/11, Dr Radha Krishnan Salai, Loganathan Colony, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004, India

reviews.reviewText:
Chennai Citi Center is a popular shopping mall located in the heart of Chennai. Situated in the Mylapore area. This mall has a long history and was once one of the most popular shopping destinations in Chennai. it is known for its vibrant shopping experience and wide range of entertainment options. The mall features a variety of retail outlets, ranging from national and international brands to local stores, offering everything from fashion and electronics to lifestyle products.
However, it now feels quite outdated, with fewer shops and a somewhat dull atmosphere compared to its earlier days. Recently, VGP opened a kids' play area here, which has added some fresh energy and vibrance to the place. While this is a positive step, the mall still needs more new, attractive stores to truly regain its charm. Overall, it's a decent spot for a quick visit, but it could be much better with some thoughtful updates and modern amenities.

Chennai Citi Center is a popular shopping mall located in the heart of Chennai, India. Situated in the Mylapore area, it is known for its vibrant shopping experience and wide range of entertainment options. The mall features a variety of retail outlets, ranging from national and international brands to local stores, offering everything from fashion and electronics to lifestyle products.

Besides shopping, Chennai Citi Center also has a food court with diverse dining options and a multiplex cinema for movie-goers. It is a favorite destination for both locals and tourists, attracting a crowd for its central location and blend of modern amenities with the traditional charm of the city. The mall is a great spot for casual hangouts, shopping, and enjoying a fun day out with family or friends.

The name Citi Center, Mylapore, always reminds me of the movie *Kaka Muttai*‚Äîfunny how I knew about this mall through the movie despite being in TN! It's actually a great spot with stores like Zuido, Style Union, Westside, Lenskart, and even KFC. The Cyber Bunk area is extraordinary, with amazing vibes and a well-designed space. Definitely planning to watch a movie at the INOX located here next time!

Worst Mall in Chennai

Citi Centre is the worst mall I‚Äôve ever been to. The food court is empty and sad. KFC is the best option, and even that has no proper food left. Cold chicken, half the menu not available, and the staff look tired and lost.

The whole place feels dead. Dirty walls, broken lights, and a weird smell everywhere. Most shops are closed. It feels like an abandoned building, not a mall.

The theatre is a nightmare. Drunk men were shouting, people were talking loudly on their phones, and others came just to eat and chat. No one watched the movie. No staff to control the mess. The screen and sound were bad too.

This place is a total waste of time. Feels more like a slum than a mall. Avoid it completely.

Lot has changed but the view from the terrace is just beautiful as the day the building was first opened. Fewer shops, in a way it's quiet and nice. Arcade and bowling is functional. Not overcrowded, food court has wide range of food and drinks. Calm and crowd free place to hangout with friends and family.

Came to the mall to watch movie in inox. We didn‚Äôt knw mall is under construction, be prepared for that. You can enjoy the movie in inox but don‚Äôt expect any from the mall until the construction is over. Theater was good and popcorn and tea are nice.

Update July 2025: fully constructed mall was good. There was fashion jewelry fair when we went and theater was okie. Mall is smaller than others in Chennai but it is new.

Today, I had the pleasure of visiting Chennai's iconic Chennai City Centre, one of the oldest malls in the city. As soon as I entered the mall, I was greeted by a vibrant and bustling atmosphere that immediately lifted my spirits. The Inox theater within the mall was a real treat, with its comfortable seating and top-notch sound system providing the perfect setting for an enjoyable movie-watching experience. What impressed me the most was the impeccable architecture of the mall, which seamlessly blended modern design elements with traditional touches, creating a unique and visually stunning space. Additionally, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the parking fee was only 50 rupees, making it convenient and affordable for visitors like me. Overall, my visit to Chennai City Centre was a delightful experience, filled with happy moments and fond memories that I will cherish for a long time.

My rating was

Ambiance:4/5
Parking:4/5
Hygiene:4/5
Maintenance:4/5

After a long time, I visited Chennai City Centre. We initially went to shop at Zudio, but due to the heavy crowd, we skipped shopping there. Instead, the kids enjoyed a small car ride in front of the mall. Unlike my last visit, I noticed that there are very few shops operating in this mall now, with only the theatre still functioning. However, they still charge ‚Çπ40 per hour for car parking, which feels quite high considering the reduced number of shops.

State collections including Indian art & sculpture, bronzes, anthropology & a children's section.
This large sandy beach is a popular escape for locals & visitors to Chennai.
Easygoing beach known for its relaxed vibe away from crowds & with a nearby ice cream shop.
Cathedral basilica rebuilt in 1896 in neo-Gothic style, at the site of St. Thomas Apostle's tomb.
This colourful, multi-level seaside temple with ornate details honours the Hindu goddess Lakshmi.
Long-standing shopping mall featuring an array of common retailers, along with eateries.

Chennai, on the Bay of Bengal in eastern India, is the capital of the state of Tamil Nadu. The city is home to Fort St. George, built in 1644 and now a museum showcasing the city‚Äôs roots as a British military garrison and East India Company trading outpost, when it was called Madras. Religious sites include Kapaleeshwarar Temple, adorned with carved and painted gods, and St. Mary‚Äôs, a 17th-century Anglican church.
Serene botanical garden with over 500 species of plants, including exotic varieties.
Multi-campus, public academic institution, founded in 1857 and based in Chennai with 68 departments.
This large Indo-Saracenic-style building was the residence of the Nawab of Arcot from 1768 to 1855.

Thyagaraya Nagar, known locally as T. Nagar, is a bustling shopping district with stores and street vendors selling colourful saris, gold jewelry and produce at budget prices, especially along Ranganathan Street. The area‚Äôs side streets are dotted with casual eateries and food stalls offering traditional South Indian meals. Close by, elegant art deco bungalows line G.N. Chetty Road.

Besant Nagar is an upscale, coastal neighborhood with a lively vibe. Landmarks around sandy Elliot‚Äôs Beach include the Sri Ashtalakshmi Temple, dedicated to the 8 avatars of Goddess Lakshmi, and the Karl Schmidt Memorial, which commemorates a European sailor. Christians pray to the Virgin Mary at Annai Vailankanni Shrine. Near the beach, relaxed cafes, fast-food joints and South Indian eateries fill up with locals.
Sacred 8th-century temple honouring the god Krishna, with ornately carved towers & columns.
Indoor attraction featuring manmade snow, sledding, a mountain for climbing & upbeat music.
Whimsical amusement park with bumper cars, a roller coaster & other rides, plus live entertainment.
Big aquarium with 5 aquatic zones, an underwater tunnel, touch-pool exhibit & live feeding shows.
Former ice store where Swami Vivekananda stayed in 1897, now a permanent exhibition on his life.
Pondy Bazaar, officially called Soundarapandianar Angadi, is a market and neighborhood located in T. Nagar, Chennai, India. It is one of the principal shopping districts of Chennai. Wikipedia.
A cave with tiger-head carvings is among the ruins of this 8th-century carved-stone Hindu temple.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Chennai, the vibrant capital of Tamil Nadu, is not just a hub of culture and history; it also boasts some of the most stunning beaches along the Bay of Bengal. From the bustling sands of Marina Beach, where families gather for evening strolls and cricket matches, to the serene shores of Edward Elliot's Beach, each stretch of coastline offers a unique experience. Whether you're looking to soak up the sun, enjoy a peaceful escape, or indulge in local street food, Chennai's beaches cater to every kind of traveler.

As you explore the coastline, you'll discover hidden gems like Akkarai Beach and the picturesque Palavakkam Beach, perfect for those seeking tranquility away from the crowds. The Wanderlog team is passionate about uncovering the best spots to relax and unwind, and we can't wait to share our favorite beaches with you. So grab your sunscreen and get ready to dive into the sun-soaked beauty of Chennai's coastline!
