reviews.reviewText: Great place for families, couples and friends. Crowd control was good. Kids will definitely enjoy. But poor safety measures. Especially the ray fish sections. Parents keep your kids with you all the time.,

Dry rides are kinda ok ,there was only less variety of water games
Tickets are of Rs.850
There is a food court inside and the prices are too high. ( curd rice for Rs.85 )
Restrooms needed improvement, specially the changing room. Most of rides are not active in the afternoon but in evening. Evening vgp rides with lights are so good to see . Overall it was goodüëç

It is a wonderful and peaceful place. I will try again. It is a great place to go here and get peace of mind. You should try to go here with your family.I was here getting ready the whole day and I didn‚Äôt even realize the time.This is not an emotional park, this is a haven, it will fill your heart with happiness. It is a very good place.You should also go with your family. This is a very good place. I will give you five star feedback from my side. This place is very good.

Majority of the rides were not working when I went. And all other rides were not upto the level. I don't know what their maintenance dept is doing. But it had a nice water park. You can enjoy a day with your family and friends.

VGP Marine Kingdom in Chennai offers an incredible experience, especially with its 70-meter underwater tunnel. Walking through this tunnel, surrounded by diverse marine life swimming overhead, was truly mesmerizing. The aquarium is well-maintained and showcases a variety of aquatic species, making it a delightful visit for both adults and children.

My friends and I had a great time at VGP Universal Kingdom! Although some of the main rides were under maintenance due to recent incidents, the experience was still amazing. A few new rides have been opened, and they were absolutely thrilling. The highlight of our visit was the wave pool ‚Äî the DJ kept the energy high, and we spent most of our time enjoying the waves and the water rides. Overall, a fun and refreshing day!.

Best place to spend your holidays with your family and friends. We had a wonderful experience. Kids were thoroughly enjoyed riding  and water parks.

For playing in water games, you have to wear tshirt,  you can bring your own tshirt or  can buy tshirt from there for Rs.100 each. Better to bring your own tshirt, shower cap.

Small birds park also there. You can feed them.

If you bring snacks and lunch with you can spend your whole day. It's very hot during this summer, so cap is must.

We went on weekend only, not much crowded.

Worth for money.

Weekends are fully packed. There is alot of dry and wet activities in the park. Tickets are priced at 850 INR. There is alot of improvement required, the water gets dirty and there is so much dirt in the water. The water activities, the balloon seater is less compared to the crowd, you may have to wait a very long time. Bathroom also need improvement, specially the changing room. Most of rides are out of order or not active. Overall it is good to spend the day.

reviews.reviewText: Lovely experience every time! I‚Äôve been here a couple of times now, and the food has always been consistently delicious. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the place is impeccably maintained and neat. Definitely one of my favorite spots to unwind and enjoy a great meal!

**A Memorable Evening at East Coast at Madras Square**

Nestled within the charming ambience of Madras Square, East Coast is a gem that brings together great food, warm hospitality, and an inviting atmosphere. Our recent visit left us thoroughly impressed, and it's safe to say that this place offers more than just a meal‚Äîit delivers an experience.

From the moment we stepped in, the setting was nothing short of magical. The soft glow of lights, the rustic yet elegant decor, and the soothing blend of nature with modern comforts set the perfect tone for an unforgettable evening. As luck would have it, the weather played along, with a gentle drizzle adding a poetic touch to our dinner. Opting for outdoor seating under a closed roof, we found ourselves immersed in the rhythmic sounds of the rain‚Äîa serene backdrop for the feast that was about to unfold.

The culinary journey began with piping-hot soups, rich in flavor and crafted to perfection. Each course seamlessly followed, delivering a delightful blend of taste and texture that kept us wanting more. The main course was indulgent yet refined, celebrating fresh ingredients and masterful preparation. And then came the grand finale‚Äîdessert. Every bite was heavenly, a perfect ending to an extraordinary meal.

But what truly set the evening apart was the atmosphere. Dining while watching an intense IPL match, with the sound of rain complementing the cheers and celebrations, was an experience like no other. It was a beautiful contrast‚Äîcomforting food, a lively game, and nature‚Äôs gentle embrace, all blending effortlessly into one unforgettable night.

East Coast at Madras Square is a place where food meets artistry and ambience enhances every flavor. Whether you're looking for a quiet evening or a lively gathering, this restaurant promises an experience worth cherishing. Highly recommended!

East Coast at Madras Square is a romantic dining gem! The candlelight dinners set the perfect ambiance, making it ideal for a special evening. The food was exceptional ‚Äì we loved the Herb Garlic Prawns, Bacon Pizza, Alfredo Sauce Pasta, and Roasted Beef Stir Fry. Every dish was top-notch, showcasing the chef's skill and attention to detail. If you're looking for a romantic dinner with great food and atmosphere, East Coast is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Great place. Food was nice. But we didnt plan well, just visited randomly for a quick lunch. I will visit again. The ambience is quite calling. Expensive place but worth it i suppose.
===================================

reviews.reviewText:
One of the best theme parks in Chennai.
Awesome rides with a well organized water park. Food and eateries are decent, skill games, and fancy stores are also around. My favorite was the roller coaster, the RANGER and adult slides in the water park. Awesome experience.

Good place to hangout with kids, family, and friends. Better to avoid during weekends as it will be very crowded with school children coming here for excursion trips and would have to wait a for a long time in queue to attend each and every rides. Water rides are amazing and much more relaxing after the lunch.

If you are lucky to get tickets during any sale like the Black Friday sale, it's worth the amount.

Reducing one star because of the expensive items inside the theme park. A tin of soft drink costing at ‚Çπ70 and normal water bottle at ‚Çπ30, which ideally is just ‚Çπ20 outside.

Good place to hang out with friends and families.

Sometimes offers might be there in their site so check it once before going directly to ticket counter for buying tickets.

They have normal ticket (need to wait if crowded) and priority pass ticket (no waiting in queue)

Plenty of parking spaces available but it is 200m away from entrance.
For car -100rs and bike it‚Äôs 50rs as parking fee.

Good adventurous rides are available like ranger, roller coaster, water coaster, etc.

Swimming pool, wave pool, waterfall, rain dance floor are available to have fun.

Wave pool is small when compared with other theme park.

If you are going with girl child or girls then be safe since everyone is enjoying in pool. I don‚Äôt think, there is a separate pool for kids & women.

By evening time there will be a dance floor lightening with few dancers and anyone can go and dance with them if you want.

This place is on the ECR and on the main road. People coming from north Chennai, should be starting early. I advice people to be here @10 am sharp to start early and enjoy all the rides. That too on weekends it is highly crowded and you have to wait at least 30 mins for each ride. Area of this place is not huge to cover it as like queensland. All rides are enjoyable with friends and family. Canteen is available here, no outside foods are allowed here. Prices of food is ok. Quality and quantity also ok. Few rides are really mind blowing and thrilling experience. Water games are always best in MGM. So start early and enjoy all the games till the evening. Auto or cab from here to return home may be very costly. So plan it accordingly.

It was good place. They have a good number of rides, but they are hell crowded. Please keep something to cover yourself from scorching heat. They have 2-3 diners. One of them is pure veg. They have a water park also, which gets open around 2-5 only. There are water rides for kids and adults. They have a rain dance area.  They have bucket splashes at 2 places. When I went, it was hell crowded. There is boating also. You can see the calm beach from the top of the rides amidst the palm trees. It feels like scenery.

Cost of ticket for adult - 1250‚Çπ
For child - 825‚Çπ
Car parking is the opposite side of the- 100‚Çπ for car
Since it was last few days before the school start, we decided to go have some fun. It was not much crowded. Didn‚Äôt wait in queue to sit on any ride. All ride were functional and we were able to go multiple times in each ride. Kids enjoyed too since it was their first time.
Water park was also wonderful. Wave poll, rain dance and kids area in the pool were too much fun. Lockers are available there to keep your stuffs and enter the pool.

Food and water are available inside to purchase. Food is not as expensive as I expected, 80‚Çπ for veg fried rice, 40‚Çπ for orange juice etc. It was ok.

It definitely is not worth the price at all. There are very few rides that an adult would enjoy for the price we pay. If you have been to Wonderla, this is ten times a downgrade for the high price of a ticket. In terms of dry rides, Queensland is better and cheaper. And don't even ask me about water rides; only one was functional when I went. You can definitely have fun if you go as a gang, but I would personally save up some money and time and visit Wonderla for a fulfilling adventure park fun time with friends.

It's a great experience with all the thrill rides as well as water rides..
We go with corporate booking and the team is very very helpful in all manners with full support to conduct events well ..,
Buffet lunch from Gem restaurant also awesome in taste and good coordination as well

reviews.reviewText:
This cafe is close to Valluvarkottam and has a silent and clean neighbourhood. The parking space is enough to accommodate 2-3 cars, and few bikes at a time.

This cafe offers a wide variety of dishes to choose from. And most of them are quite new fused dishes that are hard to find in many other cafes in this city. The time taken to serve the dishes was quite slow, but it is perfect when we either go as a couple (Date) or for a business meeting.

The taste of most of the dishes were close to perfect and the quantity seemed good for the rates offered. I would highly recommend trying their soups and starters.

A perfect cafe in the city for a date.

food is tasty here. Good restaurant for a lunchout with our loved one. Very quiet place with cosy ambience, with peaceful lamp lights. Today climate is chill ‚òîüå¶Ô∏è,rainy outside so it was very nice experience here watching out from the window. Had a soup, Pizza and a Chicken appetizer that made us full today's lunch. Can visit during weekends. Parking is also available. Service is also good and helpful here. Take a Lunchout and Enjoy!

Eclectic, quaint and cozy!¬†¬†That's Basil With a Twist for you, located at Habibullah Road Chennai.  Have been a frequent here for quite some time now with no regrets.
The ambience is quiet and laid back.¬†¬†The seating is comfortable with ample space. The service is passable though you need to wait a while to get their attention.¬†¬†The pricing is a tad bit high, though.
Minestrone Soup, Grilled Fish with Pepper sauce and the Frittata were swell.

The best place to eat STEAKüí•
I have been looking for a best steak in chennai and came across this restaurant which has lot of positive reviews in google comments and so we give it a try.
This is my first steak in my life and i have order tenderloin steak(Medium cooked) with mashed potatoes and it was the besttt.
I loved the combo and it tastes as I expected.
And also we tried lasagna and some peri peri chicken sides, it was great too.
Lasagna was creamy and cheesy, it was more than enough for one.
5/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è for foods and service.
Will definitely try again in futureü´∂.

We had a wonderful dining experience at Basil With a Twist. The ambiance was serene and refined, offering a true fine dining atmosphere. The time we visited was particularly pleasant ‚Äî quiet and undisturbed, with just the soft hum of background music accompanying our conversation and meal. It felt like the space was entirely ours to enjoy.

The food was exceptional. We started with two types of soup, both rich and creamy with just the right blend of spices and herbs ‚Äî a comforting and flavorful beginning to our meal. For the main course, we chose a thin-crust pizza which was equally delightful, perfectly baked and generously topped, striking a great balance between texture and taste. The menu offers an impressive variety, ranging from Asian to Continental cuisines, catering to diverse palates.

For dessert, we tried the tiramisu and tres leches. The tiramisu had a bold coffee flavor, which some may find slightly overpowering, but the tres leches was pure indulgence ‚Äî light, moist, and full of flavor.

Overall, it was a memorable experience, and this place has certainly earned a spot on our list of favorites. Kudos and heartfelt thanks to the Basil With a Twist team for their warm hospitality and exceptional culinary experience.

Basil with a twist is on a calm street with a beautiful ambience and a good Italian menu. They have many vegeterian options right from soup to maincourse. Roasted pumpkin soup and veg green Thai curry is a must, but that can be served with the sticky jasmine rice to be more authentic. Portions can be a little more generous. Only one toilet that had a constant queue.
Superb taste. I loved pumpkin soup. Lasagna is average. Overall a very good experience. Very relaxed ambience

Great food

reviews.reviewText: This restaurant is an oasis in the heart of the city! The moment you step inside, the lush greenery transports you to a peaceful world. The interiors are impressive, with beautiful flooring and AC indoor seating. But the outdoor seating truly shines - surrounded by lush greenery, uniquely designed lamps add a warm glow, and the quirky chairs and tables make it a charming spot. The outdoor seating area feels like a secret garden, perfect for relaxation. The food is exceptional, with standout pizzas, delicious chicken dishes, and mouthwatering desserts. But the real highlight for me was the abundance of friendly cats roaming around - a cat lover's paradise! Definitely worth visiting again and again for the outdoor seating, food, and feline friends!"

Went there for a late Saturday brunch after getting recommendations from a couple of friends regarding the location and ambience of this cafe. It's located in the heart of the city but the whole area is covered with trees and plants and makes you feel you're somewhere way out of the city.

Coming to the food, we ordered one Pesto Fusili pasta with potato and beans and omlette along with iced cappuccinos. Everything were delicious and filling. They have cocktails on the menu as well along with a bakery with a lot of cakes and pastry options.
Overall a great experience but we felt the price is a bit on the higher side. Will definitely recommend this for a leisurely weekend breakfast/brunch.

Visited Wild Garden Cafe in Chennai ‚Äì no doubt, the ambience is absolutely beautiful and peaceful. It‚Äôs a great place for pictures or just to chill for a while.

But the food and service were a huge letdown.
We ordered cold coffee, hazelnut cappuccino, and chicken pizza ‚Äì none of them were good.
Cold coffee tasted like diluted water, not even cold. The cappuccino had too much froth and lacked flavour. And the pizza? The chicken felt undercooked and totally off.

On top of that, it‚Äôs super expensive, and we literally spent 20 minutes just trying to figure out the menu ‚Äì nothing was clear and the waiter wasn‚Äôt helpful.

Might visit again just for the peaceful vibe, but definitely not for the food.

The food and atmosphere here are quite good, but the service really needs improvement. The staff at the billing counter were unresponsive and did not engage properly when we had queries. The serving team also came across as a bit judgmental, almost as if customers are expected to order more dishes to be treated well. Guests should feel comfortable ordering what they can consume without being made to feel uncomfortable.

Overall, while the food is nice, the service experience takes away from it.

Located in the middle of the city, you find a cafe that is so good, you visit it twice in one week!

I wasn't expecting much, until we walked through a small courtyard to this restaurant.

It was very old British decor, food was excellent, to the level of UK standard and service was good too.

The prices are not for your average local, but for visiting tourists, this is a great place for senior management meetings and friends.

For coffee lovers, I recommend Mochaccino. Stir-fried Chinese cabbage and chicken was good. Dark chocolate can't go wrong üòã
Just the service needs to be improved. The table was not cleaned. The staff was polite but not quick.
Overall, the green lush filled ambiance makes up everything. Never felt so close to nature in a cafe before.

Beautiful garden-like setting with great music and decor. Loved the in-house florist, boutique, and home items. However, the food was average and the menu was hard to read. Worth visiting for the vibe.

Beautiful and calm place in the heart of the city with an excellent green ambience. Courteous and friendly staff. The food was served on time however the taste of the taste could be improved. Put together a very relaxing place to pass time with family or friends for or post lunch

reviews.reviewText: We went for Candle Light Dinner on Feb 3. It was a wonderful experience. Service was so  good and the decoration also worth for the money. Food also good, and their Desserts and mojitos are outstanding. Must visit place to experience their food and ambience.. Special Thanks for the excellent Service!!!

A very pleasant experience. Ambience is good but can improve small things like the table, chairs and plates. Food is great here and very affordable option compared to other Italian cafes. Been here twice and to mention, both the times they have surprised us with some complementary dessert and their service is very kind.

Frankly, the place wasn‚Äôt that great (overall). The service is pathetically slow and the waiter not speaking English and being clueless about what we just said doesn‚Äôt help either. There‚Äôs a lack of waiters so you can‚Äôt even inquire about your order if you need to.

We waited 1 hour for two pathetic mocktails that weren‚Äôt even good. One starter arrived quickly and one dish took 40mins and the other 50mins (in total). Such slow service despite only less than 8 guests at the place. Every single time we told the waiter one thing, he left somewhere on a scooter and took a long time to come back???

It seems there is a lack of proper organisation and management at this place.

Which is a shame because the ambience is actually good and the area is peaceful and clean, with ample parking on the street. It‚Äôs a nice place to relax. I do wish the table and curtains were clean cause they looked dirty. It‚Äôs not that difficult to wash them‚Ä¶

The food was fine. Nothing to write home about. Pretty average all in all. Half the menu wasn‚Äôt available for some reason so our choices were limited.

I would not recommend visiting this place. There are definitely better places in ECR.

Yes we went for Valentine‚Äôs Day!!

Food beverage etc got included in the package since it is candle light dinner.

A la carte is also available for walk in.

No dedicated parking space is allocated but you can park in the side ways of the road.

Go here if you want to see some serial lights. That‚Äôs pretty much all it has. I was so disappointed when they said they don‚Äôt have anything on the menu except pizza and this was a Saturday night!

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the vibrant city of Chennai, VGP Snow Kingdom offers a delightful escape into a winter wonderland, making it an ideal destination for families looking to beat the heat. This indoor snow theme park is not only the largest in India but also the first of its kind in Tamil Nadu. Visitors can revel in a variety of activities such as sledding down snowy slopes, engaging in playful snowball fights, and exploring whimsical igloos and palaces scattered throughout this enchanting landscape.
placeMetadata.address: SH 49, next to VGP Universal Kingdom, Injambakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600115, India

reviews.reviewText: Best to go on weekdays as there will be less  crowd and more time to enjoy. There is a 45 min time slot. There are other things to see as well. 12D theatre, animal safari, and a museum. Ample car park is available at the front of the establishment. They provide all necessary attire before you enter the premises. Staff are very friendly. Need to experience it. Recommended.

‚ùÑÔ∏è Snow Kingdom, Chennai ‚Äì A Cool Escape in the Heart of the City!

Visited Snow Kingdom recently and had an amazing time! From the moment you step in, you're transported into a winter wonderland with real snow, icy slides, and loads of fun activities. The temperature drops instantly, and it‚Äôs a refreshing change from the Chennai heat!

They provide all the necessary winter gear like jackets, boots, and gloves, which are clean and well-maintained. The snow play area is spacious and perfect for families, kids, and even groups of friends. The music, lighting, and overall vibe make it a joyful experience.

The highlight for me was the snow slide and the snowfall simulation ‚Äì truly magical moments. Staff were polite, safety measures were in place, and everything was well organized.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun, chilly adventure without leaving the city. Perfect weekend getaway or birthday surprise idea too!
The snow experience was very good. We enjoyed a lot. But the activities service inside was available only for 30 minutes after that staff went out. That‚Äôs something which was not good.

Sure! Here's a rephrased version of your review for Snow Kingdom:

---

If you want to experience what -8¬∞C feels like, this is a great place to try it. The first visit is definitely worth it ‚Äî a unique and exciting experience. They allow only 45 minutes inside, which is more than enough because it's extremely cold. While it may not be worth visiting a second time, the initial experience is truly memorable.

Had an amazing time at Snow Kingdom The place is well-maintained, super fun, and perfect to beat the Chennai heat. The snow slides and activities were exciting, and the whole experience felt like a quick trip to a snowy paradise. Highly recommended!

VGP Snow Kingdom indoor is an absolute blast for both kids and adults! From the moment we stepped in, it felt like being transported to a snowy mountain village ‚Äî without leaving the city. The snow was real, soft, and fresh, and the temperature was just right to enjoy comfortably with the provided jackets,hand gloves and boots. Also they ensured it‚Äôs properly cleaned before giving to next visitor.

The space is well-maintained, clean, and very safe for families. There are plenty of fun activities like snow slides, snowball play zones, and even mini igloos for the little ones to explore. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made sure everyone was enjoying safely.

Only key improvement is needed in WASHROOM. Not happy with quality of cleanliness and standards set by VGP Management.

Ample parking space available.

Perfect for just experiencing snow in chennai. Highly recommended for some chilly fun and unforgettable memories!

It was a huge change for us this beginning of summer as we had a kulu-manali moment at 1/10th of the price in snow kingdom near vgp theme park. though expensive, it was worth it. Online booking available as also spot booking. Rs.750 per person and if you want additional jungle safari and 12D they charge another 200 for both. Childrens loved it. Highly recommended.
45 minutes of experience under temperature below zero. Certainly kids will enjoy the snow and play. Wear fully covered clothes to avoid exposure to snow.

placeMetadata.description: Sizable complex featuring a range of retailers & restaurants, plus cinemas & a boutique hotel.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Express Avenue Mall in Chennai is a vibrant destination that seamlessly blends shopping, dining, and entertainment. This expansive complex boasts an impressive array of retailers ranging from high-end brands to charming local boutiques, ensuring there's something for everyone. After indulging in retail therapy, visitors can savor diverse culinary delights at the food court or catch the latest blockbuster at the cinema. Families will appreciate the dedicated kids' play area and gaming arcade, making it a perfect spot for all ages to enjoy a fun-filled day out.
placeMetadata.address: 17, Pattullos Rd, Express Estate, Thousand Lights, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600014, India

reviews.reviewText: I recently visited this mall and had a great experience. The entire place was extremely clean and well-maintained. The environment was peaceful and welcoming, making it a perfect spot for shopping and spending time with family or friends. Everything from the layout to the staff's behavior reflected good management. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a pleasant shopping experience!

I‚Äôve visited Express Avenue Mall many times with both friends and family, and every visit has been a great experience. The mall is spacious, well-maintained, and has something for everyone. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for shopping, watching a movie, grabbing a good meal, or just spending some quality time, this place never disappoints.

There are plenty of popular international and local brands to shop from, and the variety in the food court is amazing from fast food to fine dining. The movie theater is also excellent, with comfortable seating and good sound quality.

What I also love is how clean and organized everything is. Security is good, and parking is convenient. It‚Äôs one of those places where you can easily spend a few hours without even realizing it.

Overall, Express Avenue is definitely one of the best malls in Chennai. I always look forward to going back!

A good shopping mall in the heart of Chennai city. It has all varieties of shopping stores and it is a happening place especially during weekends. Parking is available downstairs. Food court is not good as it doesn't offers much restaurant. The mall is good, however the food courts needs more scope for improvement.

Express Avenue is one of the best malls in Chennai. It‚Äôs got a nice mix of big brands, local stores, and a solid food court with plenty of options. The cinema here is also really good. It‚Äôs spacious, clean, and a great place to hang out with friends or family. Parking can get a bit crowded on weekends, but overall it‚Äôs a go-to spot for shopping and chilling in the city.

Express Avenue Mall is one of Chennai‚Äôs most popular and upscale shopping destinations. Located in the heart of the city, it offers a great mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment options that cater to a wide range of visitors.

The mall features a good variety of international and Indian brands, from high-end fashion labels to popular high-street stores. Whether you're looking for clothes, electronics, accessories, or cosmetics, you're likely to find what you need here. The layout is spacious, with wide corridors and multiple floors connected by escalators and elevators, making it easy to navigate.

Food options are a major highlight‚ÄîExpress Avenue has a large food court with plenty of choices, from fast food to regional cuisine, as well as several standalone cafes and restaurants. The cinema experience at Escape (by SPI Cinemas) is also top-notch, with comfortable seating and high-quality sound and visuals.

Cleanliness and security are well maintained, and there‚Äôs ample parking, although it can get crowded during weekends and holidays.

Pros:

Wide range of stores and brands

Excellent dining options

Modern, clean, and well-maintained environment

Central location

Cons:

Can be very crowded at peak times

Premium pricing at some outlets

Overall, Express Avenue Mall offers a complete shopping and leisure experience and stands out as a must-visit for anyone in Chennai.

If you are looking for a shopping center with local and international branded stores this is the place to go. The express avenue has a lot of branded stores.

I would say the express avenue is the one stop shopping. Apart from many branded stores, there are also many restaurants and cafes as well.
It is also a well maintained shopping center.

Visited  Express Avenue Mall with my college friends right after exams, and it was the perfect break we needed üéìüíÜ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüè¨. The moment we stepped in, the cool ambiance, wide open space, and calm vibe felt like a treat after all the stress ‚ùÑÔ∏è‚òÄÔ∏è. It wasn‚Äôt just a mall visit ‚Äî it became a memory of freedom, friendship, and pure joy üíñüõçÔ∏è. Truly a beautiful place to unwind in the heart of Chennai!

placeMetadata.name: Dakshina Chitra Heritage Museum

sources.snippet: Dakshina Chitra or the south gallery is a living history museum that narrates the Tamil history and culture of times gone by. This small open air gallery-cum-village houses replicas of South India everyday life artefacts from 19th and 20th Century. You get to see the folk, craft, art, architecture and much more used by the local fishermen and villagers.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Chennai (Madras) (2025)

sources.snippet: Description: Dakshina Chitra is one of the most charming Romantic Places in Chennai, where you may lose yourself in the cultural tapestry of South India. This open-air museum‚Äôs historic architecture, artwork, and handicrafts make for a pleasant, educational, romantic day trip.
sources.shortName: Discover The Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

placeMetadata.description: Cross cultural museum featuring 18 historical houses, along with art, crafts & performances.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Dakshina Chitra Heritage Museum in Chennai offers a comprehensive experience of South Indian culture, traditions, and artworks. The museum features 18 historical houses and showcases art, crafts, music, and dance forms from four major South Indian states. Visitors can explore exhibits on pre-colonial clothing, farming practices, and architecture. Additionally, the museum hosts performances and has stalls selling traditional jewelry, fashion items, and souvenirs.
placeMetadata.address: State Highway 49, Muthukadu, Tamil Nadu 603112, India

reviews.reviewText: DakshinaChitra Heritage Museum is a must-visit place in Chennai to experience South Indian culture, art, and architecture. The traditional houses from different states are beautifully preserved and give you a glimpse of history and heritage. There are live crafts, art workshops, and cultural performances that make the visit even more engaging. The campus is well maintained, peaceful, and spacious ‚Äî perfect for families, students, and anyone interested in culture. A truly enriching and memorable experience.

In today's electronic age, children are growing up with limited understanding of their roots and a diminished appreciation for what they possess. This place offers a wonderful opportunity to visit and impart knowledge of our heritage. They have meticulously recreated various aspects of South Indian cultures and related replicas, while also actively promoting historical arts and handicrafts. I strongly recommend that families, especially those seeking to instill values in their children, consider a day outing here. It's a commendable initiative supported by excellent companies.

Great place. Presents a slice of South India. Very well maintained. Some shows, puppetry on the weekends, for instance available. Great place to click some pictures: several South Indian style houses, art exhibits, sculptures and artifacts. Favours the folk, and the Tamil. Ideologically left leaning. Need at half a day to have a meaningful visit.

Bags are not allowed inside. Amenities available. Shops sell you stuff, beautiful stuff, but expensive. No exclusively vegetarian eatery inside.

Must visit if you are in and around Chennai.

It‚Äôs really a worth visiting place when in Chennai‚Ä¶ If you have even a little interest in knowing about South Indian heritage and particularly about traditional houses in various regions..
A very well maintained premises with lots of trees and nicely paved walking path.. There are some nice small handicrafts and souvenir shops to buy from.
There‚Äôs also a small canteen for tea/coffee/snacks and a full fledged restaurant that offers South Indian veg/non meals at very reasonable rates and offers good taste.

Has always been a favorite of mine to spend a quiet weekend. Brought some out-of-town visitors this time, and they loved the heritage museum set up with interesting tidbits, authentic houses, folk dance performances and shopping. Would be a great idea to add food that is traditional and authentic to each of the southern states as small eateries or restaurants.

A cultural heritage on the southern India and lots of activities for the children to explore the creativity thinking. A timely shows on each places of real character which will be make us to enjoyment and fun. Really worthy and takes minimum 5-6 hrs to explore..

Everything about the museum is good. You‚Äôll need an entire day to truly explore and learn from it. It‚Äôs a wonderful experience not only for kids but also for builders, architects, or even anyone dreaming of constructing their own home.

So why only 3 stars? Mainly because of the confusing layout and lack of proper guidance. Some areas are not well maintained‚Äîcertain buildings and rooms are closed without explanation, while others are being used for storage. Although I was given a pamphlet with a map, it was hardly useful.

From the entrance to the exit, there should at least be clear milestones or directional boards. For example: ‚ÄúStart here ‚Üí Next visit Tamil Nadu House ‚Üí Exit this way. To visit Kerala House, follow this route,‚Äù etc. Without proper instructions, it‚Äôs very difficult to fully enjoy and experience the cultural richness and diversity showcased in the museum.

I visited Dhakana Chitra Heritage Museum with my family last weekend, and it was one of the most enjoyable and enriching day trips we‚Äôve had in a long time. This place is more than just a museum ‚Äî it‚Äôs a well-planned heritage village that combines cultural learning with a comfortable, family-friendly environment. I‚Äôll share my experience in detail so that it helps anyone planning a visit.

‚è∞ Timings & Entry
The museum is open from morning till evening (usually around 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM), and I recommend arriving as early as possible. We reached around 10:30 AM, which was perfect because the place was less crowded, the weather was cooler, and we could take our time exploring without rushing. The ticket counter staff were friendly and explained the map of the place so we could plan our route. They also mentioned the timings for any live demonstrations happening that day.

üßπ Cleanliness & Maintenance
One of the first things I noticed was how incredibly clean and well-maintained the entire place is. The pathways are swept, there‚Äôs no litter anywhere, and the gardens are beautifully trimmed. Even the restrooms ‚Äî something I‚Äôm always cautious about when visiting public places ‚Äî were spotless, with running water, soap, and hand-drying facilities. The traditional houses and displays are also well-kept, with no dust or neglect, which really adds to the pleasant experience.

üç¥ Food & Refreshments
There‚Äôs a small but well-run food court area inside the museum grounds. The menu is simple, offering local South Indian snacks like dosa, idli, vada, and upma, along with fresh juices, coffee, and tea. Prices are reasonable, and the food tastes fresh and homely. We had a late breakfast of masala dosa and filter coffee, and it was delicious. For lunch, there‚Äôs a traditional thali option that gives you an authentic taste of local cuisine. There are also cold drinks, bottled water, and ice creams available, which is great if you‚Äôre visiting with kids. The seating area is shaded, clean, and surrounded by greenery, so it‚Äôs relaxing to take a break here.

Arrive early to avoid the afternoon heat and crowds.

Wear comfortable shoes because there‚Äôs a lot of walking.

Keep a hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen handy.

Carry some cash if you want to buy directly from artisans (though the main food court accepts digital payments).

Plan to spend at least 3 hours here ‚Äî more if you have kids who want to explore every corner.

üèõ Museum Layout & Attractions
The museum is designed like a small village, with different sections showcasing heritage from various parts of India. Each house or structure you enter has information boards in English and regional languages, explaining its history and purpose. This makes it easy for both adults and older children to understand and appreciate what they‚Äôre seeing

üé≠ Cultural Performances & Seasonal Events
Depending on when you visit, there may be live folk dance or music performances. We were lucky to catch a small folk dance performance in the afternoon, and it really added to the atmosphere. During festival seasons, the museum often has special events, craft fairs, and workshops for kids, so it‚Äôs worth checking their calendar before you go.

üå≥ Atmosphere & Comfort
The entire place has a very peaceful, relaxing atmosphere. Even though there‚Äôs a lot to see, it doesn‚Äôt feel rushed or crowded. The shaded walkways, occasional benches, and water refill stations make it easy to take breaks. There are plenty of trees and open spaces, so it‚Äôs never stuffy.

If you‚Äôre into photography, the museum is a paradise ‚Äî every corner is photogenic, from the colorful doors to the hand-painted walls and traditional artefacts

üõç Shopping for Souvenirs
Near the exit, there‚Äôs a gift shop selling authentic handicrafts, postcards, and handmade toys. Prices are fair, and the quality is much better than what you‚Äôd find in typical tourist markets. We picked up a couple of hand-painted wooden keychains and a small terracotta pot ‚Äî perfect as reminders of our visit

reviews.reviewText: We took a speed boat ( 3 members) and paid 1200 for a 10 minute ride. The ride was very thrilling and it was a wonderful experience. Speed boat is a must try here !

Muthukadu Boat Club is a hidden gem for anyone seeking a peaceful escape near Chennai! The tranquil backwaters and lush surroundings make it an ideal spot for boating and relaxation. The pedal boats and rowboats are fun and well-maintained, offering a great way to enjoy the scenic beauty. The staff is friendly and helpful, adding to the pleasant experience. While the food options are decent, a bit more variety would be a welcome addition. The place is perfect for families, couples, and solo travelers looking to unwind. A few upgrades to the facilities, like seating areas and restrooms, could make it even better. Overall, a must-visit for a serene day out by the water! üåäüö§

Good place for boating. They have different boats - speed boat, motor boat, row boat, water scooter and pedal boat. We took a motor boat which costs rs 1020 for 20min. A restaurant and small snack shops are also present in the premises. Parking is also available.

The best time to visit is during a weekday at 9 A.M when they just open it  and you will find less people at that time. They also have recently introduced this Seanz cruise which has a floating restaurant, different packages are available. Please contact them for more info.

Super place ü§©. Very relaxing, calm and enjoyable place to spend time with family. Tons of boating options available üö£, such as, rowboats, pedal boats, motorboats, speedboats, and high-speed aqua scooters üõ∂. Fantastic view üå≥‚ú®. Would highly recommend to visit TTDC on evenings üåÖ

placeMetadata.description: Besant Nagar is an upscale, coastal neighborhood with a lively vibe. Landmarks around sandy Elliot‚Äôs Beach include the Sri Ashtalakshmi Temple, dedicated to the 8 avatars of Goddess Lakshmi, and the Karl Schmidt Memorial, which commemorates a European sailor. Christians pray to the Virgin Mary at Annai Vailankanni Shrine. Near the beach, relaxed cafes, fast-food joints and South Indian eateries fill up with locals.

reviews.reviewText: The restaurant was very clam and there was lot of options for Non-veg as well as veg. Really loved how all dishes were cooked exquisite traditional style and ingredients also. While the ambience is quite simple, the food makes it totally worth it. If you love South Indian non-veg food, this place is a must-try at least once.

Our experience at Sorgam was pleasant‚Äîthe food was served quickly, and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I visited with my cousins, who love non-veg food, and they absolutely enjoyed it. As a vegetarian, I was happy to see a good selection of dishes for us as well. Their Thali is perfect for sharing between two people. The unique display of starters before ordering is a great touch, making it easier to choose what to try. Definitely a place worth visiting!

reviews.reviewText:
My Favourite spot in Chennai.
Morning sunrise view is an Eye Catchy.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Edward Elliot's Beach is one of the most popular and serene beaches in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Located in the upscale neighborhood of Besant Nagar, this beach is a favorite spot for locals and tourists looking for a peaceful seaside experience.

Highlights

Scenic Beauty: A clean and less crowded alternative to Marina Beach, offering beautiful sunrise and sunset views.

Restaurants & Cafes: The area around the beach is home to many famous eateries like Murugan Idli Shop, Jonah‚Äôs Bistro, and Mash Resto Caf√©.

The nearby Ashtalakshmi Temple and Velankanni Church attract visitors for spiritual experiences.

A great place for morning or evening walks, jogging, or just relaxing by the sea.

Besant Nagar Beach offers a refreshing coastal escape with beautiful sunsets, clean sands, spiritual landmarks, and vibrant street food‚Äîin a much calmer setting than busy city beaches. However, be mindful of rising vendor clutter and occasional sanitation concerns. Overall, it‚Äôs a top choice for a relaxed day out, especially in the mornings or evenings.

Best experience you can get here. We went on a weekday and it‚Äôs more quieter than marina beach during night. Nice walking path in the beach and it‚Äôs clean. There is also skating park for kids.

The shops are clean and as it‚Äôs weekday not all shops opened. Overall a must visit beach in Chennai. Don‚Äôt miss this even if u miss Marina beach.

Besant Nagar Beach is a wonderful spot to visit. While the beachfront is relatively small, the area is moderately clean and well-maintained. It boasts a wide range of food options, from local street vendors to popular multi-level restaurant chains, offering a variety of cuisines to enjoy.

Besant Nagar Beach is a wonderful spot to visit and truly a delightful experience. The beach is clean, the atmosphere is calm, and the streets nearby are filled with amazing street food that adds to the charm. The park area with its various rides is also worth exploring and makes the visit even more enjoyable. The only drawback is the presence of persistent beggars and vendors, which can be bothersome, so it‚Äôs good to stay cautious. Other than that, Besant Nagar Beach is definitely a must-visit destination in Chennai.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Bessie Beach, is hands down one of my favorite places in Chennai. I‚Äôve been visiting it regularly ‚Äì both early in the mornings and late at night, and each visit has something special to offer.

üåÖ Sunrise at the beach is a serene and beautiful experience. The soft golden light, the gentle sound of waves, and the cool breeze instantly lift your mood. It‚Äôs the perfect time to go for a peaceful walk or just sit by the shore and soak in the calmness before the city wakes up.

üåá Sunset, on the other hand, brings its own charm. The sky turns into a canvas of oranges and pinks, and the atmosphere becomes livelier with people strolling, kids playing, and street food vendors lighting up the beachside. There‚Äôs something so refreshing and calming about the place, no matter what time of day it is. The moment you step onto the sand, you feel a sense of peace and lightness that only the sea can bring.

üéâ One of the exciting things about Bessie is that they screen IPL matches on big screens during the season! It adds a vibrant community vibe, with people cheering, relaxing with friends and family, and enjoying snacks while watching the game in the open air with the sea breeze around.

Whether you‚Äôre looking for quiet reflection during sunrise, chilling with friends in the evening, or even just grabbing a bite from the food stalls, Besant Nagar Beach never disappoints. It‚Äôs clean, lively, and safe, and has become a sort of personal escape zone for me within the city.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Chennai or even locals who haven‚Äôt made this part of their regular routine yet!

Watching the sunrise at Besant Nagar Beach is truly magical. The first light of the day slowly coloring the sky, the gentle sound of the waves, and the cool morning breeze create a peaceful and refreshing start to the day. The view is simply amazing ‚Äî worth waking up early for! A perfect spot for nature lovers and anyone looking to recharge their mind and soul.

Basant Nagar Beach is one of those places where the city‚Äôs chaos fades away, replaced by the calming rhythm of the waves. Whether you visit at dawn, when the sky blushes softly, or in the evening under the moonlit glow, the place feels magical. The waves are lively but soothing, and the breeze carries that unmistakable salty freshness.

There‚Äôs a lively stretch near the shore with small stalls, local snacks, and the hum of people enjoying themselves, yet you can always find quieter corners to just sit and watch the ocean. The beach is perfect for long walks, photography, or simply letting time slow down while the waves kiss your feet.

If you‚Äôre in Chennai, Basant Nagar Beach isn‚Äôt just a spot‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience. üåä‚ú®

With its sprawling trees and diverse wildlife, visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls while spotting various animals that call this park home.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Theosophical Society, founded in New York in the late 19th century and later relocated to Chennai, embraces the principle of universal brotherhood regardless of race or religion. Its lush grounds feature a remarkable garden with diverse trees and an ancient banyan tree spanning thousands of square meters. Visitors can revel in the tranquility away from urban noise and explore various religious monuments on site, including a church, mosque, Hindu temple, Buddhist shrine, and Zoroastrian fire altar.

The Theosophical Society in Arunachalapuram, Adyar, Chennai, is a serene and historically rich location that serves as a center for spiritual exploration and philosophical inquiry.

Visitors are greeted by beautiful gardens filled lush greenery with a variety of flora, since it is located on the banks of the Adyar River, creating an atmosphere that encourages contemplation and connection with nature.

The Theosophical Society was founded in 1875 by Helena Petrovna Blavatsky, Henry Steel Olcott, and William Quan Judge in New York City. Its establishment marked a significant moment in the history of modern spirituality, aiming to promote universal brotherhood, study ancient religions, and explore the underlying truths of existence.

Under the influence of Blavatsky, the society expanded internationally, with the Adyar headquarters in Chennai becoming a pivotal center for theosophical study and practice. This rich legacy continues to inspire individuals seeking spiritual growth and understanding.

The architecture of the main buildings is striking, showcasing a blend of traditional Indian and European styles. The intricate designs and thoughtful layout reflect the society's commitment to fostering a sense of peace and harmony.

One of the most noteworthy structures is the headquarters, which houses a library rich in esoteric literature, making it a haven for those interested in spiritual texts and theosophical teachings. The library is not just a repository of books; it serves as a gathering place for discussions, workshops, and lectures, drawing individuals from diverse backgrounds who share a common interest in spirituality and philosophy.

As you wander through the grounds, you may come across several shrines and memorials dedicated to prominent figures in theosophy. These sites are imbued with a sense of reverence, inviting visitors to pause and reflect on the teachings and legacies of those who have contributed to the society's mission. The peaceful atmosphere is often enhanced by the sound of birds chirping and the rustle of leaves, making it an ideal spot for meditation or quiet contemplation.

The Theosophical Society also hosts various events, including lectures, seminars, and cultural programs that are open to the public. These gatherings provide an opportunity for individuals to engage with thought-provoking ideas and connect with like-minded people. The society's commitment to universal brotherhood and the exploration of spiritual truths resonates throughout its activities, fostering a sense of community and belonging.

The Theosophical Society is not only a hub for spiritual and philosophical exploration but also home to one of the largest banyan trees in India. This magnificent tree, which is estimated to be over 100 years old, spreads its branches wide, creating a natural canopy that offers a cooling shade and a sense of peace. The banyan tree serves as a symbol of longevity and resilience, reflecting the society's enduring mission and its deep roots in spiritual inquiry.

Visitors often find themselves drawn to this majestic tree, using it as a serene spot for meditation or quiet reflection. Its expansive network of aerial roots and branches creates a unique and enchanting atmosphere, making it a popular backdrop for photographs and a favorite gathering place for those seeking solace amidst nature. The presence of such a magnificent tree enhances the overall beauty of the society's grounds, contributing to the tranquil environment that encourages introspection and connection with the natural world.

Accessibility is another notable aspect of the Theosophical Society. Located in a bustling locality Adyar, it is easily reachable by public transportation, making it a convenient destination for both locals and tourists.

Whether you are seeking knowledge, peace, or simply finding a beautiful place to unwind yourself, the Theosophical Society is a remarkable sanctuary that invites exploration and reflection, leaving a lasting impression on all those who visit.

It is a very nice place. But public is not allowed inside. Only people with high power and money (like politicians and actors) have the privilege of walking inside this place. It is a private walking place for them.

Loved the experience of nature!!!! Tha place was so cool, fully nature!!!!!
Church was so beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è
The oldest tree with many branches was so amazing
They have vast varities of plant from different countries..
Still they follow oldest method of cultivation ..
In display they have collection of rare cultural records ..
Awesome experience every location ..
Want to visit again!!!!
Loved their quote in their LOGO "THERE IS NO RELIGION HIGHER THAN TRUTH"
Awesome Place for Nature Lovers #theosophicalSociety

In a mysterious and serene forest-garden in the heart of Adyar, along the river banks lies the Theosophical Society of Chennai. Built on three main principles, this society seeks universal brotherhood without distinction on race, gender, creed or any other factor. Delve into their gorgeous gardens, teeming with flaura and fawna and you will assuredly have quite a remarkable evening. Those who love reading and learning about new ideologies and life philosophy, will find this Society especially interesting, though the library is off limits to tourists.

If you step out onto the garden outside, the sounds of woodpeckers, parakeets, cuckoos and sparrows singing and trilling will greet your ears. Small animal species that are unique to the city can be seen scurrying around in the grass and playing in the trees. You can spot jackals and mongoose, as well as other small animals. The main attraction is a huge, 450 years old Banyan tree, supposedly the oldest in the world, with roots covering up to 60,000 square meters. Strolling through the garden is extremely peaceful, away from the chaos of the city and little shrines can be found throughout. Peace will engulf you as you study nature at its calmest, so be sure to take your time and appreciate all the beauty around you.

The main ideologies of the Society are;

To form a nucleus of the Universal Brotherhood of Humanity, without distinction of race, creed, sex, caste or color.

To encourage the study of Comparative Religion, Philosophy and Science.

To investigate unexplained laws of Nature and the powers latent in man.

Google maps is worng the society is just down the bridge maps showing me 500 metres away..  Sat an Sunday is close order day is open its only purely natural place I seen sum bird's witch I can seen in chennai.. No any orthe entertainments, food at all. 1 hour is maximum to see the place.. Suitable for natural beauty lovers,

placeMetadata.name: Kapaleeshwarar Temple

sources.snippet: Kapaleeshwarar Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is ideal for experiencing spiritual serenity. This stunning Dravidian architecture and the divine ambience make it a unique and spiritually enriching spot. Couples visiting places in Chennai and searching for religious sites can come here.
sources.siteName: Zingbus - Explore Your Next Travel Destination
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Chennai- Places to Visit in Chennai for Couples

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the vibrant neighborhood of Mylapore, Chennai, the Kapaleeshwarar Temple is a magnificent testament to ancient Dravidian architecture and spiritual heritage. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, revered here as Sundareshwarar alongside Goddess Meenakshi, this temple dates back to the 7th century CE.
placeMetadata.address: 234, Ramakrishna Mutt Rd, Vinayaka Nagar Colony, Mylapore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600004, India

reviews.reviewText:
A magnificent temple dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva.. As a non Hindu, I found the guided tour of the temple and surrounding sites by our tour company Enchanting Travels to be well researched and informative and the huge temple grounds a must do when visiting Chennai.
We are here during the annual event of 2025. It was an amazing experience.

"Visited and it was truly a serene experience! The architecture is stunning, and the atmosphere is so peaceful. The priests were welcoming, and the rituals were performed with devotion. I felt a deep sense of spirituality and connection. Highly recommend for those seeking solace and tranquility. A must-visit!"

Visited Kapaleeswarar Temple recently, and it was truly a beautiful experience. The gopuram is stunning with its intricate carvings ‚Äì you can spend quite some time just admiring the details. Inside, the temple has a very peaceful atmosphere despite being busy most of the time. the chants and lamps made it feel even more spiritual.

The area around the temple is also lively with small shops and traditional food stalls, which adds to the charm. Parking can be a bit tricky, and the crowd is usually heavy, but that‚Äôs expected at such a famous temple. If you‚Äôre in Chennai, this is definitely a must-visit, both for the architecture and the divine experience.

Visiting Kapaleeshwarar Temple was a truly divine experience for me. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the temple‚Äôs stunning architecture and intricate carvings are breathtaking. The premises are well maintained, and the atmosphere is filled with peace and devotion. Who ever that visits this temple will definitely feel calm, blessed, and spiritually uplifted.‚Äù

It is one of the oldest and powerful Shiva temples, which is located in the middle of Chennai.
One of the best landmarks of Hinduism in Chennai.
Even though it is in mid of Chennai, inside the temple premises, you feel such a divine and spiritual attainment.
Both Shiva and Ambal Sannithi give pleasant and divine feelings.
You will feel more relaxed after getting dharshan from Shiva and Ambaal.
Mostly in the evening, cultural programmes which reflect our traditional and together chanting of the Shiva Puranam give a higher elevation of our spiritual level.

This temple is a true example of South Indian architecture. Built around the 7th century, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Whenever I visit chennai i make sure to go to this temple the aura the architecture the sculpture and the serenity of this hindu temple attracts me so much. Like Gorakhpur temple of UP here also I saw lots of idols of sadhus . Photography of idols is prohibited. This time i visited the temple early morning around 5 am still I could see good number of devotees there.  If visiting Chennai must go to kapaleshwar temple for darshan.

Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Mylapore ‚Äî a classic Chennai landmark that feels timeless the moment you pass the towering gopuram. The nadaswaram and tavil during puja, the fragrance of jasmine and camphor, and the bustle around the temple tank create a beautiful, old-Madras vibe. Darshan usually moves smoothly; priests are courteous and the premises are kept clean with clear signboards and organized footwear counters. Visit early morning or around the evening aarti for cooler weather and fewer crowds (festival days‚Äîespecially Panguni Peruvizha/Arubathimoovar‚Äîget packed). Dress modestly; photos are fine in the outer prakarams but avoid the sanctum. Parking is easiest around the tank streets.

Secret tip: after offering at Karpagambal‚Äôs shrine, step to the Punnai (temple) tree and look up‚Äîyou‚Äôll spot carvings and imagery of the peacock tied to the temple‚Äôs legend. At sunset, walk the tank‚Äôs east side for the best reflection shot of the gopuram.

One of very famous temple in Chennai , it is my first visit and had great darshan here . The management maintains the temple and its surrounding in very clean manner . All sannadhis are visible from long itself which I feel so special. Even in heavy crowd can have a good view of Mulavar from outside itself . Idols of 108 Nayanmargal around Mulavaru gives you the divine vibe . Must visit in weekdays as it is lightly crowded even on Friday odd hours . Definitely in weekends or in special occasions temple will be heavily crowded . Must visit Temple OM NAMAH SHIVAYA üôè

placeMetadata.name: Chamiers Cafe

sources.snippet: Chamiers Cafe is a beautiful, quaint place with a very vintage, subtle and romantic vibe to it. It has one of those dreamy decors with pastel colours and drapes, making it look all the more charming. Apart from its aesthetics, soothing interiors and cosy ambience; it also has some really nice food.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Romantic Places In Chennai (UPDATED 2024)

placeMetadata.description: Stylish, vintage-style cafe offering international dishes, salads & breakfast.
placeMetadata.address: New # 106, Old # 79, Pasumpon Muthuramalinga Thevar Rd, RA Puram, Nandanam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600028, India

reviews.reviewText: Food is good and offers a range of options. Not to mention, people would love the atmosphere here. It could be a comforting nook for you amidst a hustle and bustle of the city life. Tea was way better than coffee. Coffee beans they are using are a wee bit on an acid and stronger side with no delicate notes of nuts or chocolate. I recommend main courses and some side menus.

A relaxed place for a lazy reading day with amazing coffee and good food. The place has different sections of seating. Ground floor has women's boutique and first floor has a men's wear section, women's jewellery and cafe. The cafe itself has two partitions. One with beautiful chairs and meant for a date brunch or casual meetings. The second section is more cozy with books lined on shelves and cushioned chairs and sofas. Pick any book you like, read for how ever long you want. Their selection of breakfasts and coffees are definitely worth more visits. Hosts and servers are friendly and helpful with any queries about the menu. The waiting time is fairy short in the mornings but lunch rush will have you waiting for at least twenty minutes. But it's worth all the waiting.
Definitely hungry to try more dishes!

Very calm and neat space for any kind of hangout. Work friendly too! I have a very mixed opinion in food, yes it is overpriced and veg pizza was way too cheesy, sea food pizza was too bland. Only the arabiata pastas were enjoyable but also with extra tanginess. Dessert varieties are as same as wild garden cafe and the taste was üëåüèª. Luxury with a very very average dining and unresponsive service; Keeping the restrooms and washrooms downstairs did not feel very hospitable. Couldn't recommend for a good meal.

We had a lovely experience. The food was great and the ambience was perfect for a cozy night. We tried the Beef tenderloin burger, Carbonara pasta, a chicken quesadilla and a burn basque cheesecake. Really loved the wedges that came with the burger. Everything was delicious.

Pesto penne fantastic! The juices freshly pressed! No oat milk or almond milk available.. (maybe only today?). Mostly men working as waiters (everyone super friendly but where is the gender equality?) would definitely come back.
Lovely ambience. We were really surprised how cozy it was. Food choices were great. Absolutely one of our favourites now to visit often.
This is hands down my favourite cafe in Chennai, no matter how many places I always come back here. I also absolutely adore the cats<3

The atmosphere was very inviting. I loved seeing the old pictures that were displayed on the walls. Food and service was good. If ever I will be able to visit Chennai again, I'll definitely dine here again.

placeMetadata.name: Aqua

sources.snippet: Aqua is a very romantic place located in the center of the city. With the cool breeze tossing your hair and the live music played by the pool will make the whole scenario filmy and memorable. The most loved food here in the main course is Raita, Dal, Indian bread and Biryani.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

placeMetadata.description: Drinks and Mediterranean nibbles are served around the rooftop pool at this luxury hotel.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Aqua is a laid-back and classy poolside restaurant located in the heart of the city, offering a dazzling view from its rooftop setting. It's an ideal spot for enjoying drinks and Mediterranean nibbles while lounging by the pool or catching up on work. The atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed day with your partner, exuding a romantic vibe complemented by live music and a cool breeze.
placeMetadata.address: The Park, 601, Anna Salai, near US Embassy, Gangai Karai Puram, T. Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600006, India

reviews.reviewText: Amazing experience! The captain and bartender were excellent. Abhijeet followed our order instructions perfectly, while Bhaskar truly impressed us with custom cocktails made to our taste, way beyond the menu. Great service, great vibes. Highly recommended! Please ask him to make Bhaskar special cocktail and get surprised.

Aqua In The Park Is A Rooftop Poolside Alfresco Restaurant That Has Introduced A New Menu Serving Tandoori Mini Idly, Chicken 65, Mutton Seekh Kebab, Pasta, Pizza, Cheesecake & More.

Tandoori Mini Idly: Mini Idly Coated With Parmesan & Cream, Cooked In A Tandoor & Served With Mint Chutney. Rich, Creamy & Tasty. Must Try.

Peri Peri Paneer Fingers: Panko-Fried Cottage Cheese Fingers Served With Spicy BBQ Sauce. Crunchy & Tasty.

Crispy Fried Chicken 65: Chicken 65 Tossed With Cashew Nuts, Bell Peppers & Barbeque Sauce. Chicken Was Tender & Tasted Very Good.

Bade Miyan Mutton Seekh Kebab: Minced Lamb Cooked In A Tandoor, Served With Mint Chutney. Tasted Good.

Grilled Bay Of Bengal Prawns: Prawns Cooked In Red Pepper Garlic Sauce With Sundried Tomatoes & Olives. Prawns Were Meaty & Tasty.

Penne Alfredo: Penne Alfredo Pasta Topped With Sundried Tomatoes & Olives. Tasted Good.

Tandoori Prawns Pizza: Thin-Crust Pizza Topped With Roasted Bell Peppers, Jalapeno & Prawns. Tasted Good.

Maa Ki Dal, Boconccini Cheese: Dal Makhani Topped With Boconccini Cheese. Tasted Good.

Mixed Vegetable Jalfrezi With Corn: Bengali-Style Gravy Of Mixed Vegetables & Corn. Tasted Good.

Mutton Rara Seekh Kebab Masala: Mutton Curry Topped With Mutton Seekh Kebab. Tasted Good.

Cheesecake: Cheesecake Topped With Mixed Berries Compote. Smooth & Tasty.

Tiramisu: Classic Recipe Of Late Chef Antonio Carluecio, Who Curated The Recipe With Mylapore Filter Coffee When He Visited The Hotel In 2005. Yummy & Tasty.
One of my favorite ramen spots in the city, super underrated. Chef Aniket does a fabulous job! Adela and the other others make you feel right at home! Big ups!

First thing first! The door is really narrow! And the place is as in the photos. Would suggest adding a little bit more for night time ambience. Food was awesome! We loved the sushi that they had specially delivered for us from another restaurant in the hotel called Lotus. The Melon breeze was nice and the pesto pasta turned out to be white sauce but taste was really good. But is the experience worth the price not really. Server was very accommodative but will need a little bit more communication training. Oh and be ready for mosquitoes!

I dined at Aqua yesterday for the first time along with my family. We thoroughly enjoyed the food and the ambience. The Bay of Bengal prawns made by chef Umair was delicious. Will be visiting soon again. Thanks team Aqua

Aqua - located at 8th floor inside The Park chennai. The ambience was nice with live-screening and pool on another side. They do have private cabana which you need to pay extra.

They have limited menu. We ordered Persian kebab, Loaded nachos and Fish tikka for starters. Followed by Fungi pizza and Chicken tikka pizza. They do serve alcohol and mocktail. The food was really good especially loved their Persian kebab. It was cooked to perfection. I felt quantity is bit less for the price tag. The service by Abhijit and Manikandan was excellent. We also had little chat with Chef Mr.Ashok post dinner. The staffs were so polite! You can have some quality time with your loved ones here.

An open sky dining lounge by the pool side with an average seating capacity and eye catchy setup which makes it little fancy. But have a lot to improve on services and food verity specially for guests from other regions like north and west.

Ratings on restaurant out of 10:

Food quality: 7.5
Taste: 7
Ambiance: 5
Food presentation: 7
Service: 3 (extremely poor)
Seating capacity: 6.5
Staff politeness: 8
Value for money: 5

*Services and staff attentiveness needs to be improved a lot.
** Avg one person dining cost is ~ INR 2000 Plus, which I consider likely to be overpriced for the services and food offered.
*** Ambiance around was okay except a few unwanted people with some unsocial/casual behaviour noticed. Not really expected in a 5 star hotel.

I recently visited Aqua with my friends and was impressed with the food and overall ambience. They have launched their new menu and Bay of Bengal prawns was my favourite from it made by Chef Umair. He even came and spoke to us after the meal. Great hospitality.

placeMetadata.name: Above Sea Level Restaurant

sources.snippet: It is a rooftop, five stars hotel located at the topmost floor of Raintree, Alwarpet. They serve Continental, North Indian, Seafood, and Mughlai.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

placeMetadata.description: Sophisticated rooftop space at a hotel offering elevated city views & upmarket Indian cuisine.
placeMetadata.address: The Raintree Hotel, No. 120, St Marys Rd, Austin Nagar, Alwarpet, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600018, India

reviews.reviewText: Had an amazing time at above sea level! The service was fantastic, and the desserts were prepared flawlessly. the manager on duty md. Nazeer and patra took care of all of our needs and went above and beyond with his hospitality.
Everything there was so good... Ambience, the food and customer service.And they also had lice singers in the house.. they were also awesome.

Been here recently-ambience was great, food was good, couple of dishes were really great- mushroom baklava and avocado toast, risotto was a miss, chicken and mash potato was good- can see the Chef really inspired to show his handiwork! Negatives- we were asking for a table in the upper deck and it was not given as it was reserved for regulars, we booked through dine out app and it said it was 30% of the total bill including alcohol but we had to pay alcohol bill separately- so is it a marketing gimmick from both parties? Kudos to the guys who waited on us as they went and above and beyond to make it a pleasant experience.

A very good place with exquisite sky line and food. One should definetly try mushroom baklava, cheese kurtosh, tomato soup, paneer tikka. Aam cigars, bharwan aloo can be slightly better. The accompaniments were especially extremely nice and better such as tamarind chutney, mint chutney, garlic mayo etc. The servers gets extremely busy in rush hour, which makes the service comparatively slow which shojld be streamlined. Thr major problem is the light attracted bugs, which sometimes gather around the table lamp and thus poses a threat to fall on the food items.

We (9 of us) went to the restaurant for a team dinner. The place was more expensive than anticipated. Love the atmosphere, you can go there to enjoy the view and vibe. Food was good, but quantity was too low and service was quite slow. Apart from that, I enjoyed just being there, the live music was unexpected and very pleasant.

Wanted to go some place exotic for our 17th anniversary . Chose this place as it has a Northindian menu. Called and fixed a reservation. They accepted. But they never told us that we could reserve a table with a good view. If given the option I would have. Only if I knew. We reached on time and was shown a table. Not bad view but If they had told me I would have taken a table with better view. What's going to a roof top without a great view?.
This restaurant has both Italian and Northindian limited menu. Not anything listed out of the menu is done here.. Small tables with a battery powered egg shaped LED lamp. The ambience is great and it's breezy. Also there are a lot of mosquitoes. So make sure to wear full sleeves and full pants.
The music is loud but pleasant. We were given a menu. Also we can scan a QR for menu. There is also a separate alcoholic beverage menu.
We ordered Paneer EKhas for the starter. It's a regular paneer tikka. Paneer was succulent, soft. It was mildly spiced and tasted lovely. The ginger chutney and mint chutney along with paneer tikka was so heavenly that we ordered it again.
We ordered main course and it came after an hour. Really after 1 hr. I'm not joking.
For main course we ordered Cheese & Butter naan and Bharwan paneer Makhanwala.
The Naans were average. Not very soft or very fresh.
The paneer gravy is the worst I have ever had in my years of life of loving Paneer Butter masala. Don't be  fooled by the soft paneer starter. The paneer in the gravy was hard, chewy and stale and the gravy tasted so yucky that we didn't want to have any more of it. We didn't want to pack it and bring it either despite it costing Rs700 + tax. Those of you want to eat, order at your own peril. Or you may need to discard it after the first serving.
Penne e verdure di stagione is a Penne white pasta. It was cheesy and subtly spiced and tasted good but over time when it became colder it started to lump together and became very chewy. Secondly no seasoning was offered for the pasta. We wanted to ask for seasoning but all the waiters were very busy. Already it was late and we didn't want them to delay things much.
There was a surprise cake for us as we talk them that it was our anniversary. Cake too was too soaked in sugar syrup and didn't excite our taste buds.

On the whole the bill was RS. 4078 which included a 6% service charge

Pros : Hospitality and Ambience
Cons : Food and Not letting us knew that we could book a table with view

Will I return?. No. Never until they get the paneer gravy right.

Beautiful interiors , premium cutlery, lavish seating arrangements set the tone, mood and ambience to feast upon the food.Have been here on multiple occasions.There is lots of variety in starters, main course, rice plates,sweet dishes.
The best is the Sunday brunch. Lots and lots of variety. Enjoyed my food to the maximum.

The most amazing restaurant - I have never experienced more fabulous waiters and waitresses than the ones at above sea level restaurant ! They have truly made this trip for me. Special mention to Sharansh, Pranay and ShimWe have been  in Chennai for 2 weeks and have been unable to tear ourselves away from this restaurant. The food is incredible, the views and the atmosphere unmatched, but nothing has been better than the service and the poeple who work here. Huge thank you to the staff. I can‚Äôt wait to return !

placeMetadata.name: Thiruvalluvar Nagar Beach
placeMetadata.description: Popular, sandy strand known for its sunsets, plus vendors selling grilled corn & other street food.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The beach in Thiruvalluvar Nagar is a popular and sandy strand that is well-maintained and known for its beautiful sunsets. It's also home to street vendors selling grilled corn, which makes it a great spot for food lovers.
placeMetadata.address: Valmiki Nagar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041, India

reviews.reviewText:
If you're looking for a beach in Chennai that offers both cleanliness and calm, Thiruvanmiyur beach is a hidden gem worth visiting. Unlike many of the more crowded and commercialized beaches in the city, this beach stands out for its good hygiene and well-maintained surroundings.

The ambiance is particularly pleasant ‚Äî peaceful and scenic, especially after 7 PM when the crowd thins out and the entire place takes on a calming, almost meditative vibe. It's a great spot for anyone looking to unwind, reflect, or just enjoy the gentle sea breeze without much noise or chaos.

One of the biggest highlights is the sense of safety here. Even at night, the beach is safe to visit, thanks to the regular police presence.Thuruvanmiyur beach offers a cleaner, quieter, and more peaceful alternative to the usual Chennai beaches. Whether you're a local or a tourist, it‚Äôs definitely worth adding to your list.

Nice place to watch sun rise. Less crowded in the morning. Place to got for daily walking/jogging.
It is cleaner than some beaches in Chennai
Lots of local shops are there nearby where you can get snack like potato rings which is quite famous these days.

Breezy Beach a hidden gem‚Äîsunrise views, clean sands, and a chill atmosphere. Cycle along the shore, watch turtles during nesting season, it's less crowded than Marina. Perfect for families, yogis, joggers, and nature lovers.

Thiruvalluvar Nagar Beach in Chennai is a serene and less crowded spot, ideal for peaceful walks and relaxation. The clean shoreline and refreshing sea breeze make it a pleasant escape. Sunsets are particularly beautiful.

However, amenities are limited, so carrying essentials is recommended. A good choice for a quiet outing.

Calm beach, clean too., visited in July 2025.

There is a nearby food street with some good options for tea, juices, milkshakes, momos, sandwiches, ice creams, pakodas, etc..
worth visiting  in evening times and enjoy some cool breeze with the waves.

Thiruvanmiyur Beach is easily one of the safest and most peaceful beaches in Chennai. Unlike the crowded and noisy cityside beaches like Marina beach, but this place feels calm and relaxing. What makes it better is ,the regular police patrols visiting the beach , even at 2 AM! I once went there with friends to celebrate a birthday late at night, and the police politely advised us to leave for safety. It showed the genuine care, where I heard some harsh words from other police‚Äôs for these kind of activities.Big respect to Thiruvanmiyur police for handling things so responsibly. The beach is also super clean and they also work hard and doing regular maintenance with tractors and workers. Sadly, some people still litter. If stricter action is taken, the beach could stay even more beautiful and green.
It is a very well maintained beach. There are entry fees for people and cars that help the TTDC maintain the place well.
Great for morning times. Good area to walk. Clean wrt other beaches

Serene botanical garden with over 500 species of plants, including exotic varieties.
Hill with views & a 1523 shrine on the site where St. Thomas was thought to have been martyred.

ops.insert: Longtime reptile zoo & crocodile sanctuary/breeding center with feedings & a night safari.
Elegant Asian-continental fusion restaurant with shady garden seating & a sea-view roof terrace.
Oldest artists' commune in India, with art galleries, museums & an open-air theater for dance.
Popular beach offering a sandy shoreline & swimming spots, plus the Karl Schmidt Memorial.
Upscale seafood dishes served on a spacious, bayside patio with a bar at the Vivanta by Taj hotel.
Modern planetarium with a 360-degree theater for a virtual tour of the night sky & astronomy shows.
Italian favourites offered in a relaxed house with a spacious outdoor garden patio and live music.
Arty haveli-style cafe with garden and veranda tables, an Indian clothing boutique and flower shop.
